text: Good prices unlimited crab leggs awesome omlet station and great customer service. A must stop for

I really didn't want to try this place due to some of the reviews. We didn't have much luck in Vegas for seafood buffet. This place was very good and for the price of 20.99 on Tuesday Seafood Buffet. Now it didn't have much for seafood as I like. I enjoy crab legs and steamed shrimp. It didn't have crab legs. And the shrimp was cold. I did ask the cook at the pasta station if he could heat them up and boy did he go out of his way. He sauté them in butter and garlic and added some other spices and they were amazing. The carving station was nice with moist roast beef and turkey. The sausages was good as well. There was 4 types sushi but not what I would eat, and the fried shrimp was good. The pasta station was unique and an abundant of deserts. I did not have any since I was so full. Decent place if your close by.
really good buffet. alot to choose from. our waitress was really attentive and taking good care of us. i will return next time i come to vegas!

Der Hunger trieb uns hin ;-) und ein 2-für-1-Coupon aus dem American Casino Guide. Der Coupon wurde anstandslos akzeptiert.
Das Essen ist unterer Buffet-Durchschnitt: man wird satt, aber lecker ist anders. Okay, ich habe schon schlechter gegessen (wenn auch selten), z.B. am damaligen Riviera Buffet oder an verschiedenen Autobahnraststätten. Aber hier kann ich wirklich keine Empfehlung aussprechen, es sei denn, man hat Comps oder echt großen Hunger und man steht gerade zufällig genau vor dem Buffeteingang und will nicht mehr weiter laufen. Aber selbst dann würde ich mich lieber noch woanders hin schleppen, selbst im Golden Nugget gibt es bessere Alternativen.
Die Essensauswahl ist typisch für Vegas-Buffets: von jedem etwas. Leider ist hier alles suboptimal zubereitet und ziemlich geschmacksneutral. Die meisten Sachen sind Convenience Food (also fertig angeliefert und aufgewärmt).
Die Raumatmosphäre ist okay (wobei der Buffetbereich tatsächlich etwas von einer Autobahnraststätte hat). Wir hatten Plätze mit Blick auf den recht belebten Poolbereich. Das ist auf jeden Fall ein Pluspunkt, denn viele Vegas Buffets sind komplett geschlossene Räume (ohne Außenfenster).
Zur Info: Wir waren unter der Woche zur Lunchzeit dort.

This place is the reason why the old downtown is dying. 

The food is despicable! Stale, stale and stale are the only three words I can think of

Some of the items I dare not eat much less touch as they look more than two days old! 

I want my money back!  It cost about $25 per person, a total rip off

We went this past Sunday afternoon

The servers have the most sour face I have ever seen at las Vegas 

I honestly believe that this place is a huge harm for Golden Nugget. Just close it !

U can go pay 25 plus doallars per person,on,a buffet on, the strip or spend 12 for lunch here and gett the same thing...up to u.   ok so its a little different lol but in reality me and my wife spent about 60 dollars the day before for lunch and today we spent 24 and we got just as full so you take your pick. it was good

The salad bar, fruits and desserts were the best part of the buffet.  The service was very good also.  The prime rib didn't have much flavor, although the ham was juicy and tasted like honey baked ham.  The steamed clams were very dry and difficult to chew.  My son-in-law loved the fried shrimp and had several servings of that.

If I could give it 0 stars I would. We got there around 8ish it wasn't supper crowded...now we know why. It's 21.99 for the seafood and more buffet (the only one for dinner they offer)...I was expecting at least some quality seafood. Nope! Literally they cold shrimp, muscles, and oysters. They were suppose to be on ice but they were in mostly water and looked like it had been out for 4-5 hours (not appetizing). The line was 10-15 minutes to just get to the seafood part. They had very minimal selection of pretty much everything. The food was Bland and needed salt. I seriously will not be going back. For 5 dollars more go to the rio....a way better selection for a little bit more!

The Golden Nugget's buffet was pretty good. We payed 17 dollars a person which is fairly cheap compared to some buffets in Vegas.
By far we ate the shrimp and crab legs the most. The selection was good: seafood, asian, Italian, American, plenty of desserts.
If your in the area this is a perfectly fine buffet to go to but no need to drive out of your way to come here.

I really enjoyed this buffet 10 times more than the buffet at the "Wynn".
Not to mention the price difference. I paid almost 15$ more at the Wynn for less of a variety that I personally was looking for. I like buffets that have a large salad variety, and don't focus so much on dessert!

We've eaten at many breakfast buffets in Las Vegas and although some of them have more variety, none of them were tastier than the Golden Nugget.  It's kind of hidden away on the second floor which maybe helps with the long lines, we walked right in both times.  The omelette guy actually seemed to love his job and deposited my perfect creation with a smiling "Viola!".  Saying happy stuff in French makes my food taste better - science.  The waiter and waitress were attentive for a buffet and a great meal was made better!

I stop by this buffet and for the price is okay. No sparks or fireworks but it is clean and you do get some choices make your own pasta bar, meat craving, deserts . I think it deserves 3 starts because you get your money's worth sit down and relax enjoy the pool view . You could go to another sit down restaurant and probably get fancier food but then again this is a good deal and I believe is the nicest buffet in  the old Vegas. So if you happen to be in downtown Vegas and you just gotta eat and don't want to wait till you get to the strip then eat here. Or if you have the funds to eat at a nicer restaurant in downtown Vegas then do so.

not gonna' lie, the customer service here is hit or miss. a lot of the older women servers seem to have attitudes, although i'm not sure why. the food is decent, and various, but again, decent. you kinda' get what you pay for though at $20-25.

It got one star because they definitely serve food here. There's a reason they charge you in advance. Usually there are at least one or two standout dishes but this was all less than average. Norms would have been a better choice and would have cost 1/3 as much. Do yourself a favor; avoid this place like the plague.

It was soooo good especially with pretty cheap prices. Staff was very friendly too. Except the tortilla man. He was kind of mean. The food isn't some cheap cafeteria food, but as you can expect it's not 5-star dining. It's pretty reasonably priced. Love this place; wish I could bring it back home with me.

I've been to almost all of the buffets at the big strip hotels, and paid over 70 bucks for some of them.  I wasn't planning on partaking in the GN buffet because of the poor yelp reviews. But I did out of hunger and convenance. I was pleasantly surprised. The food was just as good or better than others I've paid much more for. It was a great selection and everything I tried was fresh and at the appropriate temperature. Our server was an older gentleman named Frank. He was awesome. Very friendly, accommodating and funny. After our meal there we were sorry we didn't eat there more often. The only thing I wish the golden nugget would bring back is the steak and eggs midnight buffet. I remember years ago they offered that. It was always a full house and delicious.

It was great that we got Comped tickets for the Friday night Seafood special...but one word to describe it "Horrible" the hot crab legs were mushy and old looking, the seafood stew was mostly sauce with some type of mystery meat floating around, the beets, green beans, mashed potato,etc etc were all canned food type quality, the shrimp and mussel station was nothing more than cooking it it in a cup of butter and some spices.  Save your $dollars and buy a burger at the snack bar next to 
the sports book.

Worst buffet in Las Vegas.  $23 will get you a limited selection of small, dried out seafoods; way-oversalted cooked dishes and stale out-of-the-box desserts.  There are so many other places in town where you can get a much better quality dining experience for less.

This was my first buffet experience in Las Vegas, and I was amazed at the variety, quantity and quality of the food. It was Thanksgiving and they not only had the usual Thanksgiving offerings, but Oriental and Italian, among others, as well. Sadly, a good percentage of the food I selected happened to be cold, resulting in 4 stars, instead of the 5 I wanted to award.

On Monday the 7th, we had the 2nd best service (thanks to Kristin at the Hideout) of our trip. The hostess was friendly, nice and went out of her way for us even though we "look like trouble". The selection was great and our waiter was excellent as well. Thanks.
Stay away as far as you can from this buffet. Got food poisoning after eating at this place. Besides for the price they are charging, the food selection wasn't that good all. Stay Away.
Worst Buffet ever, poor service and nothing tasty, which cost you 30 bucks, better not choose this oneeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

I rarely write reviews, but this was THE worst buffet my husband and I have ever had in Vegas. To be honest, the food was so forgettable that I can't even remember what we ate, but there wasn't a single item that either of us had where we could say, "mmm, that's good."  At $20 per person, I expected a lot more. Don't waste your money here. The buffet at Main Street Station blows this place away in price, selection and taste.

My family and I had the dinner buffet at the Golden Nugget. For $24.99, there wasn't much of a selection compared to other expensive buffets out there. Some of the foods were dry and taste like blah. The prime rib was all bloody (yuck). We've been to many different buffets and I think the cheap ones are way better than this place.
It's just alright. Thanksgiving Buffett,  Turkey meat was very dry no taste or juice. Shrimp looked good. Desert were just okay, no exciting presentation.

Nothing fancy.  But it serves it's purpose.  Went here 3 times on our recent visit.  First was last Friday after we checked in and got settled.  Came early for the seafood buffet.  Granted, there should have been more seafood.  But there was just enough of a selection to stuff ourselves silly.  Snow crab legs(whole and still attached to the center of the crab), shrimp, and a Cajun steamed bag of prawns, some pieces of crab thrown in along with a piece of corn on the cob and some yummy spicey sausage.  The crab was good and sweet, the Cajun basket was awesome.  And of course there were other meats there like pork and a sad piece of meat they claimed was prime rib.  Which I consider to really be the only thing wrong with this buffet.  There was plenty of bunny food options too, fruits tons of carb dishes, and of course dessert.  Lots of dessert options and the right size since you should already be stuffed by then.  The Crème Brulie is yummy!
Lunch, we got there as they were trying to transform from breakfast to lunch.  Missed out on the bacon.  But the omelet station went on through the lunch serving while we were there.  So score on that.  
Breakfast was delicious.  The waffles are small but don't let that fool you.  They are so fluffy on the inside.  Omelets, get an omelet.  There a couple different areas for the eggs and each one is a little different.  One is plain, one with cheese, and one that has bell peppers and ham mixed in.

And like someone said before, check your coupons once you check in.  m-f is 2 for one at breakfast or lunch.  So if you are only here for the weekend, they are no use to you but if you are on a longer trip like we were, those coupons help stretch those stripper dollars you worked so hard to save up!

Out of the many buffets in Vegas, this one was pretty good.

I had a little bit of fruit, some vegetables, some pasta, some meat. I ordered a Sprite, which I could've got endless refills of if I had finished the 32 ounce cup. I didn't, but my friend did and he got free refills.

Because I went during spring break there were chocolate eggs and tie-dyed eggs dispersed all over the buffet for little kids to "hunt." That was a cute touch for families.

This place is good if you're on a budget and you're hungry.

I admit I was hesitant to eat here based on the average score, but reading recent reviews changed my mind, and I am so glad for it!  I rely on Yelp reviews to help determine where I might eat when away from home, so I wanted to add one here in support of the Golden Nugget Buffet. We had dinner around 7:30 on a Sunday - no wait to be seated. Plenty of freshly prepared food to choose from. I had prime rib, mashed potatoes, veggies, orange chicken, meatballs, and a couple other things that I could fit on my plate. Everything was hot and delicious. The orange chicken was crispy on the outside, tender breast meat on the inside. Prime rib was perfect for anyone's taste - I had an end cut that was so tender, but there was rare as well for those who prefer that preparation.  There was also a made-to-order pasta bar that looked great, but I was already loaded up with so much else!

My teen boys were in heaven with the large selection of items they enjoyed. Ravioli, short ribs, peel and eat shrimp (deveined and split for you), fried shrimp, sausage and peppers, and of course, the desserts which included hand dipped ice cream in 10 or so flavored to choose from. 

The price point was fair and the service from our waiter was perfect. I am so glad I didn't travel to the Strip and spend three times as much - I don't know how it could have been better!

Absolutely horrible. I'm no picky eater but I literally ate nothing beside there anti para salads. I was really disappointed with everything. The potatos au gratin were not even cooked!!! I only tasted a few desserts and decided to eat dinner else where. Thank god the casino comped this other wise I would have been pissed. If your looking for a good quality low price buffer,., it doesn't really exist in vegas anymore. You get what you pay for I guess.
Had the Monday night dinner buffet. Was very disappointed. Used a 2-for-1 coupon and still thought it overpriced. The place reminded me of a hospital cafeteria.

It has its on floor button on the elevator. (Awesome af.)
Walk in greeted by 2 very nice ladies with a smile.
Paid 25$ at 9pm. Far away from the food.  Ok thats cool, Got a booth it was very soft and had so many different colors of vertical lines, mesmerizing.
The guy who cut the meat looked very mad as he slices my un eat able piece of roast beef he gave me.
The refill guy was on point.  I peed two times he just kept filling my drink.
Most the food was ok, they had collard greens with bacon.  The sign does not say bacon so if i was Muslim i would be pissed. 
Great desserts though check it out 
P.s.
I don't care about grammer 
Sorry 12 grade english teacher.

Pros: Clean place. Great server. Food selection was about right for the amount you pay. 

Cons: Salty cod fish.

I informed the manager about the salty cod fish that is somehow untolerable and let my boyfriend tasted it and he agreed that it was way too much.  Good thing about this place is that they mean business. He called the chef to speak to me and explain this and that.. once you complain, they will offer you a new batch of that specific food you complained and kept on offering me something which I don't have any interest at all. But overall, I like the fact that they were so being serious about what they do and will do everything for customer satisfaction. So, good job on this one!

"Still pretty good"

We've been eating breakfast here for years. They have been cost cutting a few corners, but holding the price, which is commendable. Eggs cooked to order, several breakfast meats, bagels and lox, fresh fruits, pastries, etc. What else do you want for eleven bucks?

It's got a lot of Sysco food on the bar, but it's pretty good for hang over food. The mimosa revived me, our server dropped off a huge carafe of coffee and made sure we were hydrated mama bear style. She joked a little, which was appreciated. 
The food isn't bad, but it's not five star like some of the buffets. That's ok, because they don't charge five star prices. 
It's a buffet like most buffets you've been to. Maybe a little better. But not the top tier. If you're staying in the hotel, it's a good spot. It's not a go out of your way place. It is a place of convenience, when you're lazy, hung over and checking out like we were. 
But I like that, my boyfriend and my little situational adventures. Bloody Mary's that are spicy. Pineapple juice, and the offer of refills. 
Fudge, I was going to give this place three stars, but that suggests it's bad. And it's not. It just is. The flux and flow of tourism. The changing hands of time. People have to work. In vacation, you need to eat. 
Four stars friend.
We went for the lunch buffet. Not too many options for vegetarians or kids.  The dessert section was very appealing. For the money definitely a great choice

Value, service, quality, choices, atmosphere... Meh. 

That's it folks. Continue Yelping elsewhere.
Got the buffet as part of a show package.  The food was mediocre, but desserts were delicous!
This was one of the more of the expensive buffets I had in Vegas, $21 a person dinner on Monday and it just wasn't that good.  Just down the street at 4 Queens we had a great meal for $9.

Had a Wednesday night buffet. The $24 price for a buffet is a little high, but I think it was worth it. The atmosphere is bright and clean; the selections are numerous and varied, including both cold and warm food options. The desert bar was an amazing end to a good meal. Our waiter Phil also helped make it a great experience...
Next time we stay downtown, one meal will definitely be here...
For right around $25, I expected much more.  The eggs Benedict was poor at best.  The whole buffet was very disappointing.

Not bad, but not the greatest.  One thing I like is it's small, so much more manageable than other places.  Their fried chicken was pretty good.  They could do better with their selection of fresh fruit: canned pineapple?  Really?  Real pineapple isn't that expensive.  Do you just not want to spend the labor to cut it up?  How about a banana at least?  Also, while you can get all the grape tomatoes you want, there wasn't a sliced tomato in sight and I really wanted to make a BLT!  The carving station was decent, with a couple of kinds of sausage (the Andouille was pretty decent,) and the ham was good, but the turkey was dry, dry, dry.  Some other places offer fresh OJ, the OJ here is out of a bottle.  I understand you're going to cut some corners with a buffet, but I'd have been happier with a smaller glass of fresh (since the juice is not unlimited anyway...)

Overpriced and inedible. I never need to go to prison to know how they're fed. Don't take the chance of eating here, it's about the worst food I've ever eaten. Maybe they cater to old people and smokers who don't have taste buds left. 

1/10 would not eat again.
Chow mein and rice tasted like it had been out for a while. Egg rolls were so bomb along with the cheese cake. Pizza was good too.

Who woulda thought you can get crab legs at a place like this??

For the price, this is a great buffet spot.

We stayed at the GN hotel from 09/08-09/11 and we were very disappointed with their buffet. The selection was not a big selection at all. We are their one time during our stay and went to other places the remainder of our time.

The biggest problem with the Golden Nugget "The Buffet" is the hostess/seater.  We went for breakfast on a Monday morning, and the line was long.  After we finally got in after about a 30 minute wait (9:30 am), we knew why the wait was so long.  There was only one "seater".  Paying was quick, but with only one seater, one slow seater, we noticed many open, set tables stay open for at least 10 minutes before anyone was seated at them.  We experienced several other buffets where the staff busted their buts cleaning off tables and seating new parties.  The breakfast food at this buffet was decent, and it actually had the best selection of items at its salad bar.  One weird feature about this buffet is that there are yellow lights above most of the tables which makes it hard to differentiate colors on your plate.

So my buddy and I hit the buffet based on a great memory I had a couple of years ago. Unfortunately my memories deceived me. Let me explain why...

We went out there Sunday night - the seafood buffet is ONLY Friday and Saturday. Every other night they basically only have shrimp. While they were decent certainly nothing to write home about. For some reason they had "warm plates" right next to cold shrimp - dumb. 

As far as the rest of the food, pretty poor. The sushi was very limited and while it was relatively fresh (watched the chef making it), it was very bland. The meatballs and pasta were awful, as was the Chinese food. 

The only thing of note in my mind was the desserts. They were plentiful and in a size such that you could have a few tasters without having to pick a single one. 

As far as the staff, generally career waitresses who seem to care less. Was drinking a soda and they kept refilling it with warm soda and never added ice. 

Maybe the seafood buffet is still good, but I would t hit this buffet again unless you enjoy desserts at a slightly lower cost than the strip buffets.

I sincerely think the Golden Nugget and Fremont street are underrated. 

My boyfriend and I came to the Golden Nugget for their champagne breakfast two days in a row. Not only was the food awesome, the mimosas were flowing, and our waitress serenaded us. And man oh man, she could sing! What a wonderful unexpected treat! 

The buffet choices weren't overwhelming, and what items they did offer I felt they did well. The prime rib was tasty, the hot items were appropriately hot. The seafood section had fresh ceviche and peel and eat shrimp. The cream gravy they had for the biscuits and gravy and/or chicken fried steak was some of the best gravy i've had in a long time. The little mini egg rolls in the chinese food section were hot and crispy, and the corn beef hash was just right. The deli section had amazing smoked salmon and other deli meats...and the english muffins that pillowed the eggs benedict was crispy and not soggy! Bonus!

We will definitely make the trip back to the Golden Nugget for Champagne buffet! We've never received such amazing service at a buffet, ever. If Diane is working, ask for her! She is by far one of their hidden crown jewels. You won't regret it!

This  buffet was recommended to us, so we thought  we'd give it a try. Am not a fan of brunch, as I was in lunch mood. So I was not too happy not having full lunch menu. But I must  say this I was more then satisfied eating here. The quality of the food is great. You can tell they put effort into the meal, not just quickly thrown together. Ambiance is good. the buffet is not very big. Selection of food and deserts are good. I must  take  one star away for a few of the food items being a bit far in back, having to making a bit of a reach. For $18 and change i will definitely be returning.

Went here August 1, 2014 for dinner. Should have save my $26, it was not worth it. Smelled fishy when you walked in. Save your money. Even prime rib was tough. Service was good, not there fault food is bad.
This is the worst place to eat. All of the food was nasty. Never, ever, ever, again!!!

Before you go to this buffet, stop, look at the coupon book that you got when you checked into the hotel, and find the 2 for 1 buffet coupons.  They are good for breakfast and lunch and our book came with two of them.  This buffet is good but not worth full price.

There's not much to say about this place other than the food is very average.  The buffet itself is relatively small, so there isn't a huge amount of variety.  If you're looking for a better selection, I'd recommend going in 15 minutes before they switch from breakfast to lunch.  That way you pay the breakfast price and get to choose whether you want to eat breakfast food, lunch, or some combo.  If you're there for breakfast time, I do recommend the omelet station.  I was surprised to see they had eggs Benedict as well, but it was nothing to write home about.

Overall, I'm giving this place three stars rather than two only because of the 2 for 1 coupon.  I would never pay full price to go here but it is a good value at half price.
We came here for brunch. It's just like any hotel and casino buffet. The server was friendly and we were even greeted and attended to by the manager.
Yeah, not the greatest of buffets and a little pricey. I came for the crab legs and they're really dry. The rest of food not great either. Both Angela and I decided we're never coming back. Oh well.

This place is honest and true, big servings, great service. I had an icy strawberry shake and the Vegas stack pancakes, three huge fluffy cakes with lashings of syrup. My usual would be three but at this size I could only eat two!  Just inside the Golden Gate casino, lots of signs in the casino point the way. Highly recommended for fast, no fuss servings, good value at $20 for my partner and I. Including tea and coffee.

After walking around the block on a Saturday night trying to find a restaurant that was not packed and had vegetarian options we resorted to just going to a buffet, (they are bound to have something vegetarian friendly, right?). I have never been to a vegas buffet, so I was super excited!

The waitress let us take a tour of the buffet first to see if anything appealed to us and then we went back to the cash, paid, and got our seats.

The buffet was nice, honestly, they had a lot of great options for meat an seafood lovers. Unfortunately not a whole lot for vegetarians, but we made it work. I mostly filled up on the salad bar an cheese pizza. My hubby got a delicious cream pasta made that was really good as well as an omelet. 

The desert bar was nice, and had a great selection of sweets.

The one thing that threw me off, was the woman working the salad station. She kept taking her dirty rag and pushing all the dropped food back in the bins. Not appealing, and for sure, not very sanitary.

Two plates in and I was content, and the hubby was stuffed. Worth the price? For us, it was not, but the experience was nice.
I love the Golden Nugget but I do not love dried out, bland, uninspired food. Unless something changes magically, I won't be back.

Come here often. . However,  lately the food hasn't been what it use too. The desserts I could have come across at a cheap $8 off strip buffet.  Crab was hit or miss.. shrimp under boiled. . And nothing looked as fresh as it once was.  I saddened to say I may not be back.

Actually a very good buffet, with a great variety of items, wine is inexpensive, but dinner is pricey.  If I was downtown I would go to it but to drive to it no way.
So if you are going to the Fremont experience or downtown try it, otherwise go to someplace closer.

Since moving to NV, my husband and I are trying all of the buffets..Golden Nugget seems to be our default place when we can't decide on one. Its nice and simple, clean and friendly. Food is pretty good, nothing orgasmic and its reasonibly priced. Kids enjoy it too.
This was the most horrible eating experience. We only went around once,  that's the sign of death for a all u can eat.  Roger our server was the highlight of the night.

Ok, this is a review of the breakfast.  Don't waste your time.  Granted it only cost $8 with drinks, because of the coupon you receive when you check in.  I was not excited about any of it.  Pancakes were ok and omelets were watery.  Orange juice was good and fruit was fresh.  Nothing else looked appealing.  I'm giving two stars because I had a great view of the pool from my table.  Ask to sit on the window!

We were in downtown looking for a place to eat, we had the buffet years ago and it was ok, so we decided to give it a try for dinner. 

I have to say were were very pleasantly surprised, this was much better than any buffet I have had in the past. 

There was a large variety of food, mostly seafood but plenty for those of us that don't eat seafood. They had a baked chicken that was so moist and flavorful, I had to go back twice. 

They also had your carving station with Turkey, beef and ribs, served with grilled veggies. Wonderful.. A build you own pasta bar was good, but be careful, it was a large serving. 

The waiter was excellent, right on it with drinks and clearing plates. 

The food was very fresh for buffet food, nothing seemed to be sitting for very long.. everything had that homemade taste.. 

I was so full I didn't get to try the dessert, they had a wonderful selections of cakes, eclairs and ice cream you could get on the cone or in a dish.

I was disappointed in this Buffet! The service was good but the food was just "OK" or terrible. We were there on a Saturday night around 6pm and there was not wait, so that was nice. The main entree's were OK, the cheese and meat section was really nice however, some of that meat looked like it had been sitting out way too long to eat. Needed to be changed out. The desserts were TERRIBLE! Between the 6 of us in our party we tried MANY of the desserts and they were all old and terrible tasting except for the scooped ice creams and sorbets. Cakes, pastries, pies, pudding were not good. Next time we are in Vegas we will go to a different buffet.  
For the price it was not worth it.

What a scam. Website says $14.99 for lunch per person. But when you get there it is $15.99 a person. While a $1.00 may not seem like much but take this in mind. When I talked to the hostess she said it's been that way for over a year and they haven't changed the website. I wonder how many Tens of thousands of people have been overcharged in the process?

Food not so great and they were out of stuff.  There are a lot of other places to go. Some of the people serving... the omelette guy for instance was very rude.  the carver guy scared me, but he was harmless. sorry..I can't recommend
There are plenty of better buffets elsewhere. Don't let the popularity and upscale feel of the hotel/casino trick you into thinking the buffet will also be good.

Customer service was ok but the food was not all that great maybe if price was 13 or maybe 14 bucks. The ham was dry and the brisket was a lil to red but it had an ok taste. The biscuits and gravy had like no taste what so ever! Lol 
I would never eat here again!

Ok for brunch. Nothing blew me away as great or super tasty, but nothing was really bad either. Omelet station was a bit messy because so many people were trying to push their way in,  but other than that is s petty simple lay out. Carving station, salad bar,  dessert. Not a huge selection, but it was enough.  I didn't even eat dessert. It looked good,  had ice cream ready to scoop, bread pudding,  napoleon's, I just didn't want sweets. Server was nice,  brought refills quickly, cleared plates. Tables were clean. Restrooms just outside and close to restaurant.  The sign to get in was a bit misleading because it said something about vip cardholders when we waited by the cash register a guy told us to wait behind the ropes (we were the only ones in line) I pointed out I thought it was the vip line & he said he didn't know why the sign was there,  but he didn't take it out. Lol. He looked like mgmt to me! Must not have been his "job" to take out the sign.

Eh. I wasn't expecting too much out of this buffet but it was just, eh. There wasn't much to choose from! I really enjoyed the mac n cheese and potstickers. I was extremely disappointed when I grabbed a cheesecake that was like warm...yuck! Skip the buffet and go to Claim Jumper, it's open 24/7!

I hadn't been to Vegas downtown in years, but always used to stay and eat at the GN, where their buffet was always hands down the best in downtown!  I finally got a chance to go back, looking forward to this dinner outing last Halloween after the parade, and took some friends.  Wow, was that the wrong decision, and it was just so disappointing; hard to believe this buffet is so bad now.  I heard ever since Steve Wynn sold the hotel operation, it's gone downhill--of course I hear this all now, when it would have been great to know beforehand.  

Food was very mediocre at best, and table service was also on that par, even though the lady from Hawaii was very nice.  She got so distracted--and it wasn't even that busy--that she neglected us most of our time there.  Had to ask for drink refills all the time.  Food servers behind the counters were not all that friendly either.  Paying $26-27 for dinner on that Friday night for that service and food made me sick.  I would have rather had a hot dog at Coney Island!

Upon my return home, since I wasn't staying at GN, but on the strip, I wrote the management through the website, by email, and even by postal mail, direct to the hotel.  Here is my note:

As a long time (30+ years) patron and advocate of the Golden Nugget, I regret to say that I am extremely disappointed in our recent  dinner at your buffet (Halloween night).  I brought a party of four (My wife and another couple, our best friends) to eat dinner.  It was their first time, but my wife and I have eaten there many many times in the past years, however, we have not even been to Las Vegas in the past 10 years.  

I assumed things would be excellent (quality, selection, service, etc.) as they always had been (historically).  That was far from the truth, and unfortunately it made me feel terrible for recommending the GN's buffet for our dinner that night, to my friends.

Food quality was the most disappointing, having no comparison to even the TI's buffet which we had the night prior.  Selection was rather limited and poor, and although table service was "ok" (lady from Honolulu), most of the servers behind the buffet stations were not very hospitable, energetic, or welcoming.  The dessert guy was the only exception.

I am scheduled to stay (with my wife and son) at GN in December, but I guess we'll not be eating at the buffet.  It's so disappointing that the quality of your hotel's buffet has gone down so much!  It was always the BEST in downtown!  

We didn't try any of your other restaurants, but wonder about them.  In the past, we've tried Lily Langtree's, the Carson St. Cafe and a steakhouse (I believe), all of which used to be very good.   Now, I'm not so sure.

Anyway, I just wanted you to know about our disappointment.  

------
I never heard back in response at all!!  I guess they either don't care, or there are so many people complaining they don't have the time to respond to everyone.

WARNING:  GO AT YOUR OWN RISK!!  I WILL NEVER AGAIN.
Long lines and waiting time for starters. They need to modernise or expand. Great for a budget or pit stop run in Vegas!

I decided to try out this buffet because Paradise Buffet at the Fremont was closed.. The all you can eat was $29.. ouch... but the saving grace was The prime rib - which was off the charts!!!!!!! I ate like a beast... Seafood: clams, mussels, crab legs, shrimp, etc!! Padifilo was my server, and provided awesome service! The ladies at the front desk was also friendly and we shared laughs! Well that's my review! poorman 4 stars on this joint!

Was back at the GN buffet this past Saturday,  and i must say the crab legs were phenomenal.  How ever the lack of prime rib dropped the score down.  Wait staff was excellent.  Go there.  I will return. . .

This was HORRIBLE !!! A Huge Rip Off !!!
Not at all worth the $23.99 we paid per person.  
So disappointed on every level.
Dry carved red meat ( were calling it red meat because we don't really know what kind of meat it is.  
The woman I got some pasta from actually pulled a DIRTY SPOON out of the sink to scoop it...and she acted 
" put out " that I wanted some pasta ! 
The Server , Phil was so sweet & he is the only reason we gave 1- Star ! 
I will never go back ! Ever!!!!

We were on Fremont Street for the New Year's Eve Tribute Palooza and there was time to kill.  Metro cops had the area closed down for a security sweep.  We spied the Golden Nugget Buffet and checked it out.  

For just $20, this buffet is a steal of a meal.  I was satisfied with the food offerings.  If you make the right selections, like fresh carved roast beef or turkey, you can't go wrong for the price.

Not too bad! I came here one sunday because all they buffets on the strips had long lines. This place was Better than I expected. My gf enjoyed the oyster shooters. And the breakfast food wasn't all that bad. I went back for two or three plates. Selection was ok not as big as the stops buffets but also not as expensive.

If I could give less than one star, I would. 

Started off at 4 Queens bell desk.  I asked the bell hop for a good place to eat.  He suggested the buffet at the the Golden Nugget because everything at the the Golden Nugget is top notch and the 4Queens is always playing second fiddle to them.  My wife and I walked over to the Golden Nugget Buffet.  Since it was the holiday, the price was more then usual ($23 per person).  The menu looked good, so I said, why not.  I should have went to McDonalds.  The food was cold and not good tasting.  The prime rib was raw (not rare).  They offered to throw it on the grill for me (gee thanks).  The only thing that was good was the server (Frank).  He was friendly and helpful.  In addition, they charged my credit card an additional $10 for no reason.  If you charge at the buffet, double check your credit card statement, they over charge for real bad food.

Golden Nugget Buffet - 5 stars

Location: Golden Nugget Casino second floor. Take the escalator up like you're going to see Gordie Brown. But don't.

Atmosphere: The line to get in moves fast. Laid back and casual. Nice view of the pool if you choose to sit near the windows.

Cleanliness: No issues. Never had a dirty glass or piece of silverware here. The buffet is kept up and very clean.

Service: Diane is the best! We've been here about a dozen times and had her as our server every time. She's attentive, fun, easy-going, and brings you a smile when she brings you another mimosa. Love this girl a lot.

Food/Drinks: Bottomless mimosas. Need I say more? Seriously the best mimosas downtown. Champagne Brunch on Saturdays and Sundays for only $17. The meat carving station and the omelet station are both worth the wait. Really nice prime rib. The garlic chicken and spring rolls are my favorites for lunch and the eggs and corned beef hash are my faves for breakfast. Average salad selection, but you can throw together your own Caesar if you're feeling adventurous. The Dreyers Chocolate ice cream is truly the best ice cream ever. I'm not a big pastry fan, but if that's your bag, you'll probably like the selection. They have a ton of cookies and pastries to choose from. And they have this bread pudding with bourbon sauce that is pretty tasty. But let's be totally honest here. I come for the meats, eggs, and mimosas.

Price: Inexpensive. Especially if you play poker and get the comp. Play cards at their poker room for four hours and receive a $10 voucher to redeem at either the grill or the buffet. I recommend the buffet.

Nothing to write home about. It's your typical low budget buffet. I wasn't expecting to see an elaborate spread so I really didn't have high expectations. I should've lowered my "low" expectation. The reviews are mixed so we must've picked an off day to eat dinner here. 

Nothing really stood out expect for the pizza alfredo which the pizza guy hand tosses and makes from scratch. Everything else was just blah. The roast beef was dry and tasteless. When the guy served it me, he practically flung it on my plate and looked angry. When I asked for the au jour sauce, he acted like it was inconveniencing him. I was handing him the bowl to put the sauce in but he ignored the bowl, grabbed my plate and dumped the sauce all over my food! Literally. I mean he didn't just put it on the meat, he put it all over my whole plate. Sheesh, who does that? My plate and the rest of my food was drenched. 

The fried chicken which was now drenched in that sauce was also tasteless. The mashed potatoes were good, not fantastic but good and yes they were drenched in that dumb sauce too. Like I mentioned the pizza alfredo was really good. Even though it was drenched in that stupid sauce, I really liked it. In fact that's all I ate after that.

As for deserts. it looked very good but looks can deceive. The pastry guy was putting out new deserts and me being one who likes to talk to anyone (annoying right) told him the deserts looked awesome and asked him if they were made in house. He said they weren't and that they were bought at a store! LOLOLOLOLOLZ! OEM! I would never admit that. I did have a good laugh though. The deserts were dry. Nothing special. 

Will I go back here? Probably not, oh wait, we did go back for breakfast which was pretty good. You can order your eggs how ever you want them. I ordered over medium and asked for 1 egg but the guy misunderstood me and made two. Not a biggie, but the funny thing is, he kept dumping the eggs and making new ones because he didn't like the way they had turned out. I kept telling him it was ok, but I guess he was a bit of a perfectionist...lol. Gotta love Vegas.

I only had one meal here.  Breakfast.  And one of my favorite breakfast buffet offerings has to be corned beef hash.  And the Nugget Buffet's corned beef hash  was some of the best I've ever had!  Anywhere!  I went back for seconds, thirds AND fourths!
Food is average, good if you are hungover and need a heavy meal. Mimosas are cheap and heavy with champagne. Which is good!!! Lol
One of the worst meals I've ever had. It was like bad cafeteria food. No redeeming qualities and bad value too at almost $20 per person. Do yourself a favor and go anywhere else.

Food is neither hot fresh or tasty, even by buffet standards. The price is excessive for  a breakfast buffet, no matter how big an eater you will never get value for your money. The coffee tastes like dishwater.

Good wide selection but it all tastes bland. Egg station was the only good part. Terrible value for the price, even at half the price the quality is so poor I would not go back.

This buffet sucks I paid $48 or $58! I should've gone to one of the station casinos it's way cheaper also the food here was not even that good for $50 I could've paid $50 and gone to the damn Caesars Palace which is way prettier inside. The lady that worked in the front name Dianne I was rude to us to and some of the food was cold. I never got asked for a refill on my drink either. Next time I will go downstairs to the chart house or to another buffet like I said.

We went during the transition between breakfast and lunch (even though lunch started at 10:30 and we were there at 11 they still had breakfast items out). The biscuits were hard as a rock, the gravy had the consistency of water, and almost everything there was cold. The selection was poor at best. We would have been much happier spending a fraction of the money and eating at McDonald's.

Just a little of info on this place. It is way too expensive and kinda run down for what they have to offer. The variety seems like a lot to choose from but it really isn't. The food itself was not good. The bread looked dry and like it had been out for awhile. I tried some of the  corn beef hash, I had never tried it before because it has never looked good enough for me to eat, but this time it actually did but I must say I give it a 5/10. It was seasoned with way too much cumin. That was seriously all I tasted. So no. The employees were friendly but they kind of took too long to bring anything. I must say, the orange juice was freshly squeezed and that was the best part of it. I just look at it like I paid way too much for a cup of orange juice. I will not be going here again. :(
AWFUL! Not worth the expensive price. Food was cold and very poor quality. Left me feeling uneasy.
What can I say....I like their buffet.  Baron of beef!, cream puffs....

We had a 2 for 1 coupon so that made up for some of the negatives.

This is standard mid range buffet fare.  It all was presented nicely and looked good, but the official tasters must have had the day off.  Just about everything tasted generic.

The only standout was the chef making omelets and eggs.  He did a very good job of getting the eggs just the way I wanted them.

Actually, I thought this buffet was pretty darn good! Decent variety of choices - crab legs, fried shrimp, hush puppies, chinese food, and of course .. prime rib. I have to say, the prime rib here was excellent. Tender, tasty and the outer 'crust' had just the right saltiness to it. Mmmm. 

Lots of choices from the salad bar section. Many buffets skimp on the fixings in buffet salad bars, but I like those that let me have a variety of raw veggies to pile on as well as shredded cheese and crunchies like sunflower seeds and/or croutons. 

Desserts were pretty good. Fresh, moist cakes and a variety of ice cream flavors to choose from. I don't remember the price going in, which I take as a sign that it wasn't ridiculously priced. I want to say it was around $20. Not bad at all.

Bonus? Everyone working there was super nice. Always a plus.

buffet is overpriced, even for the prime rib.

desserts were the best. the creme brulee and the peanut butter dessert in the small plastic 45 degree angle see-through tubes were awesome

Yes if you read Walters review then you will know I am from San Diego as well and WOW are we spoiled! This buffet rivals the Laughlin buffet I reviewed before.....

Restaurant
Clean and modern would what I saw and expected it to be in worse condition, yet I was surprised. Service was prompt and they tried there best....

Buffet
Small, diner food, and small....oh I said that already. The crab legs were small and uninviting. The Chinese food was bland. No flavor in the pasta as well. The fountain coke was water down. 

Tips
1. If you don't care about quality and are staying at this casino then eat there to feel full. 
2. The check in will take longer than expected so eat there, if you are in a rush, and then check in.

Um.... for dinner, it's way overpriced for what they offer, which is really nothing.  The only thing I could really go for is the roasted chicken, because the roast beef was inedible.  I can't stand having to peel shrimp cocktail so I skipped on that.  I couldn't even go for the mexican food area because the guacamole looked like sour cream that turned green.

As for breakfast, it might be more worth it.  It's like around $11 and it's cheaper than if you go to the cafe right downstairs.  They have eggs benedict, but they overpoach the eggs... all of them.

I was not impressed with this buffet especially with the price tag. I had better food at another buffet in a much less swanky casino. They need more variety, and waiting staff to be more attentive. The lady was very much so once she came back from her break. But I would expect more from the hefty price tag.

It's an adequate buffet, if only just.

Not the largest selection, heck not a large selection period. But there's a bit of sushi, roast beef, two kinds of sausage, chicken, salad, pasta and omelet bars, a decent amount of dessert...

Price and decor reflect its status as well. Decidedly modest... but at least there was no wait.

Not worth the $20! I'm a Las Vegas buffet connoisseur and had high hopes, since Golden Nugget is the crown jewel of downtown. I can honestly say I could not have been more disappointed. The quality of the food was OK, but the selection was abysmal! By far, the least amount of options of any buffet I've been to, which is 20 +.

This is my first time here and the selection is great if you are a meat person like myself. They have a carving station with a wide variety of meat, as well as pulled pork, chicken, salmon, shrimp and more...they have a sandwich area as well as desserts  area. Would have giving it 5 stores if the staff was more attentive....price for two was $54.10 with tax...not too pricey...I will definitely return....on a side note we were sat by the windows, great view  of the pool and Shark tan.. impressive....

Recent visit, very disappointing, the guy cutting the beef has no customer service skills and needs to be reported to his management. Older mexican guy who the Nugget can't get rid of and he knows it. When my son asked him about the meat selection he responded with "this is all we have" not answering the question and the topper was I overheard him speaking to the sushi chef complaining about an Asian customer who had limited english in which he had a difficulty hearing and arrogantly had to asked her to speak english. This guy ruins it for the rest of the hard working staff.

This is definitely the fanciest and most expensive buffet in Downtown.  However, the selection isn't very large.  The food seemed fresher and was of better quality than other buffets.  However, the selection was not very large and had some odd choices available.

I would go to the buffet at Main Street Station if given a choice.

The Sunday brunch was disappointing.  Nothing seemed fresh - omelet being an exception. Cinnamon rolls were hard.  Ended up eating cereal.  On the flip side the service was great and had a nice view of the pool.  Way too many better choices than this buffet, unfortunately.

I was really disappointed in this buffet. The service was lousy and the food was tasteless. They didn't have much of a variety of food and everything we wanted was completely out every time we went up to fill our plate. We will not go back to this buffet.

The dinner buffet on Monday was mediocre at best and we got there at 730pm.  It was way over priced with the minimum options for food.  They advertise sushi and the products they used mostly came out of cans like tuna or crab.  The bbq was dry and overcooked.   The Chinese food was good but far from authentic...like the Mongolian Beef was tasty but white onions not green onions.  The white steamed rice was crispy like when it's left in a hot pan without water.  The Italian food was okay but the pizza was cheap on dough and cheese.

The best part was the omelet bar.  Fresh ingredients made to order.

I love buffets and always go back for seconds...this was the first ever time I didn't go back.

PS - the service was awesome though.  Our drinks were always full.

I was here on 10/03/16 and give them 4 stars for the options of food I could select from. The food varied from chicken and smashed potatoes ,Chinese food, pizza, build your own salad, couple options for meat, small selection of sushi and customized made to order omelette or pasta option which I really enjoyed. One of the chefs made me delicious fettuccine and lasagna . They didn't have a wide selection in desert but the service and attentive friendly staff made up for it. I would recommend and bring your appetite the food was very tasty.

Their buffet is pretty good too. It isn't the biggest I have seen, but they made up for it with quality food and neat little extras (homemade smoothies for breakfast!). 

Yes, this isn't the show-stopping buffets that you expect to see in Las Vegas, but it doesn't come with the show-stopping price. It was about $12 a person and if you are lucky and have a buy one get one coupon, it is even cheaper. Six bucks for AYCE? That isn't bad. The trick is, stay at the hotel and they will give you coupons to eat at their restaurants.

We were looking for a good place to eat preferably buffet in downtown and we ended up here and I'm really impressed the food were very good for the price we paid and our waitress was awesome.  She gave us everything we want so quickly.   Compare to paradise buffet in Freemont this is by far the best in downtown and the price is affordable.  I know for sure that we are coming back here now that we found em.

Ive never been a huge buffet fan but I actually liked this buffet. They have a bottomless champagne brunch (its 10$ extra if you want the champagne). They have a HUGE variety of food, which I need because I have a lot of eating restrictions. The food was pretty good, considering I dont expect good quality food from buffets. They have everything from breakfast to chinese food and a loved the huge salad bar. It was also clean and kept up (no food where it shouldnt be or anything questionable lol). Our server was very attentive and always made sure our glasses were full. Best buffet experience I've had (and I havent had many, hah).

First off, I know you can only do so much with a buffet.  After a while everything tastes the same.  My wife and I went to the breakfast buffet in November.  First off the moved the buffet to the second floor.  The line for the buffet is poorly planned.  There is a line to the cashier to pay, but no space to wait for the hostess to seat you.  So after you pay you are getting crammed by other people paying while you are waiting to be seated.  Just strange in my opinion.  The food there is your basic breakfast food.  Nothing great, just average.  Some of the food was not kept hot enough or replaced fast enough when they ran out.  

Overall, probably better places to eat for the price and atmosphere.
All different types of food, great enviornment, the servers are nice, the food tastes great, the deserts are deadly. Totally reccomend.
Food was either bland or overseasoned. I get that buffets are for the masses, but damn...its like the cooks don't care

A very decent buffet for the price since we had 2 for 1 coupons.
Two complete buffets for $16. Can't go wrong with that price.
I devoured a nice salad, prime rib, and peel-n-eat shrimp.
Also a slice of the sub sandwich, but had to peel off the top crust for fear of breaking a tooth.
All n all a nice experience with great hostess and servers.

one of the worst buffets I ever had
money better spent at home town buffet (which I don't even really care for)
would not ever go back even if it was free

please think twice about venturing out to their buffet

chose this out of sheer convenience a while back....   I wish the server felt like it was convenient to bring our drinks in a timely fashion.....  and then follow up to take away our plates....   spread - no selection... I really felt like I wanted my money back.... the cashier at the front was rude and clearly hated her job as I heard her bad mouth Golden Nugget and the buffet several times to other patrons... i rated 2 stars because you could always do worse in my opinion... still I wouldnt recommend...

I don't know why there's a lot of bad reviews but with those aside, the Gold Nugget buffet was decent.  We went on Thanksgiving and it took about thirty minutes before we got in to be seated.  The food stations were all busy especially the pasta line where you could customize the pasta to your liking by choosing the pasta, sauce, and the type of meat.  I was actually waiting to go further for the other food since people were waiting when really it was just the pasta line.  The rest of the food I tried like the sushi were good in my opinion.  There was a whole section for dessert and their ice cream was pretty good.  It wasn't self-serve but that was fine.  Our waitress was nice and friendly as well.  I thought this was a good buffet.

The food is pretty good. The ice cream bar is where it's at. Raspberry sorbet and orange sorbet. Seated a group of 16 for us. Some of the staff was a little rude but we didn't interact with them for long. The servers are nice and quick to clean the table for you.

I stopped in here with a group of 6 for a Sunday Champagne Brunch. For $20 you get the buffet offerings and unlimited champagne or mimosas. I think I lucked out we got to choose between both breakfast and lunch foods because I like to sample a little of each. I'm not usually a buffet-goer but overall I really enjoyed started our morning this way. 

There were typical breakfast offerings like bacon, sausage, potatoes and a bagel bar with smoked salmon (I passed), cream cheese and capers. I liked that they offered eggs benedict (overcooked, but oh well) and some of our party did the build-your-own omelette and seemed happy with it. 

The food was ok. I hear there are definitely some awesome buffets in Vegas, but if you're over in Downtown Vegas and don't want to make the trip to the strip, this is a pretty good option (if you get the champagne included).

The buffet food was at standards for vegas buffets, the desert options were endless, we went in for lunch and I love that they still offered omelettes. 
The best part of the experience was our server Clinton, he was so welcoming and friendly as well as thorough customer service. If your in downtown Vegas check it out and don't forget to stop by The Shark Tan Swimming Pool!

In my opinion paying that much for the things they have for you at the Golden Nugget Buffet to eat is just sad and cheap. It was $44. Per person and the y had everything from lox to fried spam. Out just wasn't very good to me.

This brunch buffet is very hit or miss. Several yummy items like collards, roasted vegies, General Tai chi ken, kielbasa, apple cobbler, but several terrible selection, hard hard eggs benedict, super tough and dry brisket, bla corned beef hash. Slow service. Not coming back here.

It took us 20 minutes to be seated.  The food on the buffet was not very good, and the selection was limited.  The service was rude, and the server tried to give us drinks well before we were finished because her shift was over.  We regretted spending our money here.

Small and cozy. Nice and friendly waitress.
To small selection, roast beef was over cooked and dry, same goes for the turkey.
I've now eaten here 3 or 4 times, the food was gross  every time I thought it would have gotten better, but not!!!! Everything from temperature to taste, never again!!!!

Excellent Breakfast Buffet.  Service was quick, Restaurant was clean and neatly set up.  Food selection for a bufett I thougtht was limited but the taste of the items I ate was absolutely delicious.  If the cost was a little cheaper I would have rated it "five stars".

We went for the breakfast buffet, $9.99 a person and it was excellent. They had a person making omelets and fried eggs as well as the standard scrambles eggs, bacon, sausage, etc in the buffet line. Everything was hot, there were also biscuits and gravy, chicken fried steak, French toast. Basically everything you can think of on a breakfast buffet, with good quality and everything was hot!

We almost didn't come because of some of he negative reviews we saw on Yelp 
Well I'm so so glad we decided to give it a try
The restaurant is very nice, the decor is a wonderful throw back to golden age of Vegas.   
Reasonably priced
Excellent service, our hostess could not have been any nicer, attentive or funnier.   She gets 10 stars 
The food was excellent.  Great selection from the carving station to the omelette station to the pasta station to the mountain of fresh shrimp! The salad & fruit bar where stacked with delicious fresh fruit & vegetables.   The dessert station was delectable.
We where pleasantly surprised and will be coming back.  This place is a gem on Fremont.

Service was great. Our waiter Bobby was very attentive to us. I came here because of the memories of Old Vegas. Yes the buffet may not be as lavish as the others, but the food was good and i liked many of the items.

Very warm staff and smiles all around.

So many people do not know how Vegas began. Yes the Northern Strip is all the hype, but places in Old Vegas are landmarks.

Best Buffett for the cost that I saw in Vegas. The food and fruit was all fresh and the drinks, other than alcohol, were included for $15.99. A well worth it price. If you want to travel to Fremont street, start off early and get breakfast here. You won't regret it. The buffet also has a great view of the pool. They make fresh omelette as well, my favorite part.

The Lunch Buffet -$12

 Even though it was Veterans Day & several local places were offering FREE Buffets for Vets (like myself) including the Main Street Station Casino right around the block, this was not on my agenda and I proceeded forward to try this one.

 It didnt start off well as the elevator door kept opening up even though nobody was there to get on & it wasnt going down. So I took the escalator down to the gift shop & bought a paper & went back up to the buffet on the 2nd floor. NBD. 

Then, once seated, there was the issue wt the lighting once again and I asked to be moved to a place wt better light so I could read my paper. I was gladly moved to a seat next to the full window overlooking the pool and its Aquarium, VERY COOL!! However, I did notice that at the pool ALL the guest were laying directly on the lounge pads & NO towel was being offered or laid out for them. I'm surprised as this is VERY unsanitary. Whatever, I'm not going there and laying on someone elses sweat & suntan lotion mess & its .NOT my problem.

At $12 it was a little pricey for lunch but FINALLY this buffet selections actually had some flavor to it, unlike the previous reviewed buffet. The Collard greens actually had real bacon in them and were very good & required no salt at all. The Beef Teriaki wt brocoli was actually "over sauced" & to rich but when mixed wt the Pepper, Onions & beef/chicken was very good and the perfect mix of all the ingredients blended together. And while there was no sushi (insert sad face here), there was shrimp cocktail wt medium sized pealed shrimp and a crab salad, both of which were not bad at all.

Also the Shreded  BBQ beef was very good and full of flavor. I didnt try the fried chicken or anything  from the carving station but it all looked real good and of a high quality.

The waitstaff didnt seem that friendly & helpful as my water glass went empty for quite sometime as they all casually walked by until a nice oriental lady offered to refill it even asking me if I wanted something else to drink . I didnt, but thanked her just the same.

The desert station wasnt that impressive and seemed to offer alot of mini cream puffs, cheesecakes, & the likes. I wasnt impressed at all and when I asked the lady scooping the ice cream what flavor one was she had no idea. LOL! I had a scoop anyway and I have NO IDEA what it was either (Maple? Butter Pecan? Carmel???) but it was good with a half slice of mini pecan pie.

 Overall I'd say that out of the 3 buffets downtown, for lunch, this is the best and the table views overlooking the pool & aquarium rock and must really be sensational at night!!
good deal and best lunch buffet on Fremont. Received great service from Frank! will definitely be back just for all the great desserts
Worst buffet ever! Very high priced and very low quality.  Family from out of town visited and took us there. The only thing positive any of us could say was, 'Nice decore".  Stay away.

Been here twice. Once for dinner and most recently for breakfast. During both visits there was a long line that wrapped around to the escalator. Price isn't bad. 

For breakfast, the buffet provided cereal, oatmeal, fruit, bread, and an assortment of meat. Highlight of the meal was the ham. Nice and juicy! (Usually I dont like  ham because they tend to be dry.) Tried the oatmeal. It wasn't anything special. The bagel was your typical bagel. However the cream cheese was pretty tough to even scoop out, let alone spread.

As for the service (yes there is service at a buffet!), it was slow. I was nearly done with my first plate before the waitress appeared to ask us what we like to drink.

Would I come here again? Probably not. But if they gave me a voucher for a free meal, sure I'll use it ;)

I travel to Las Vegas often and tend to try the buffet at the hotel I stay at. It's a given that not everything will be stellar but there is normally one item that I particularly enjoy. Not this time. I was so hoping for something that I even had dessert and I admit the cannoli were above par. The server, Maria, was outstanding.

Stayed at this hotel many times but never made it to the buffet. This time we drove in from another hotel to try the weekday breakfast. We got there right at the changing of the bfast/lunch menu. We paid a dollar more, I think it was $13.99. It's small, just enough.. nothing to write home about. But for the price we paid it was ok. The servers were slow with the re-fills and were never around and the guys behind the food counter were grumpy. But hey, what do you expect. I don't think, I would come for a weekend price though.

We went for Sunday Brunch paid close to $50 for two people.  I was so disappointed.  The cashiers were unfriendly and couldn't even pretend to crack a smile. The food was below average at best.  The scrabbled eggs were sitting in an inch of water and looked slimy.  When we remarked about the eggs to one of the cooks, we were ignored.  We asked for orange juice and received orange pop.  I won't go back and I recommend you stay away.  It's not worth it.

This is the worst buffet in Las Vegas hands down. If you are looking for a place where the staff is right out of South Central Los Angeles who only cater to their kind you have found the right place. I have been to a lot of buffets in Las Vegas and the food here has probably the worst flavor ever. Don't be fooled by the photo you are looking at the best of what they have.

Terrible. The service was good as far as our waiter's concern but the food was nasty. Very bland!!! Only thing I enjoyed were the fruits. Even my coca cola tasted weird like it was diet. We went for lunch and it was $15 each to get in. Robbery!! If I'm going to pay $15 the food should be tasty.

Lots of buffets to choose from in Las Vegas.  This is probably the only one I would try in the downtown area.

The place seemed clean and the food was good.  The selection could be better, but is decent.

This particular night the service was not great.  It took a while for drink refills and a long while for plates to be cleared away.

At $24 for dinner, it's not a bargain, but it's not really out of line either.  It would be a nice deal at about $18.
If you love over salted greasy food and like to pay a premium for it... Well my friends then drop on in to the Golden nugget buffet.
The food was gross. Crab over cooked, paid way to much for gross over cooked food. Will never go again.

This buffet was by far the best we have had so far. Im not a sea food eater so I couldn't tell you how that was. Im judging based on the salad bar options. This was the only one with nuts (which I much prefer since I don't eat croutons) also a beautiful charcuterie spread with fresh fruits, pickled vegetables, an array of cheeses, parm crisps and cured meats and cheeses.

Not bad. I would call this right down the middle for a Las Vegas Buffet. They had all the standard fare like Prime Rib, Ribs, and King Crab Legs. Not the widest variety but friendly staff. Decent price.

Came here on Monday night for the buffet was told to try it out very disappointed it cost me $22.00 not much to choose from it looks real good, when I took my first bight from the Chinese BBQ chicken very dry, the regular fried chicken breast and drum stick dry, the fried shrimp and desserts were fine.  Not my place to eat.

This buffet is a little expensive compared to Fremont 
and main street and has a small selection of food for the price.

 
 Most items I have tried were reasonably good but not a lot 
to offer considering other buffets are much cheaper 
and has comparable food for less with more options.

 Overall the G/N has reasonably good food but price and 
selection being weighed I would give them 3 stars, unless 
you have 2 for 1 coupon then they are a good choice.

If I could give a 0 star review I would. Very bad buffet and not a lot of options or stuff to eat.  Some of the food was even cold. Best part of buffet was the service the waiter gave us and leaving. Stay away!

We met up with some Hawaii relatives here for the Saturday Champagne Brunch.

I liked it because of the extra brunch offerings.  
I'm usually not a fan of breakfast buffets because it's usually the same ol' heavy standard breakfast foods.

Everyone went the usual route of eggs, waffles, breakfast meats, etc.
They all went to get custom-made omelets.  Normally, I would have been right there with them getting my favorite spinach-mushroom omelet but got distracted by other offerings in some of the other stations.

I went for the veggie mixes and was delighted to find a goat cheese-grape tomato mix.  (This was the main dish for me!)  Also had some grilled fish (mahi mahi?).  There were several sugar-free breakfast desserts to tempt me, but went with the yogurt-granola mix.

The lady serving our table took really good care of us.  
Since it was still really early, there weren't too many other diners.
So the atmosphere was pretty relaxed & enjoyable.
I actually wouldn't mind coming back here.

I had a breakfast buffet here (they gave it to me for free as I was staying here) and it was acceptable but nothing more really. I used to come to the Golden Nugget often in the 90s and it was much better then. The choice was acceptable, I had some eggs Benedict that were significantly overcooked (probably had been sitting there for too long) and they don't have any options for lattes or cappuccino even with a surcharge. Not nice enough to return.

I stopped by here this past Sunday morning with my fiance for the Champagne Brunch.  We were staying at the casino and after looking at the menu saw that the brunch was reasonably priced at $19.99, at least as far as Champagne brunches in Vegas go.  The inside of the restaurant looked very clean, had a view of the new pool area out of the window and did not have very much decor to speak of.

The food here was actually pretty good.  It had your standard omelet making station as well as other brunch favorites like eggs benedict and blintzes.  Beyond that they also had a little seafood area with peel and eat shrimp and crab salad, a Chinese food section, salad bar and carving station.  The servers here also kept the mimosa's coming.  Half of my flute probably got filled up 10 times or so while I was sitting there.  They start you off with a flute of it and then have a server walking around with pitchers of it who top you off.  This may go towards the fact that I ate a buffet the night before but I think that my favorite part of the meal was the ceasar salad that I made and then topped with chick peas and beets.

The bottom line for me is that I would probably stop by here again in the future.  The food was pretty good and the servers did an excellent job of keeping the mimosas full which is one of the best parts of a Champagne Breakfast.

The buffet was done very well. The restaurant at South was in very good condition and looked very appealing and clean. The wait staff was very professional, nice and accommodating for that extra steak knife. The only reason I would not rate this for five stars is because of the lack of rotation in the menu. As a guest at the hotel and meeting there multiple times I tended to desire something a little different.  Also stale Krispy Kreme Donuts should never be tolerated!  It is one of the cheapest dining options at the hotel and a very good value for your money. If you are looking for a very robust salad bar this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a very robust salad bar this is not the place for you. The desserts were excellent and home made. If you come on the weekend make sure that you are aware that the morning is brunch buffet only and is dinner time prices.

Saturday night buffet.,$51.94 for two.  All I can say is horrible and over priced. Well I'll say more. Rude service. Food is dry, bland, nasty. Broccoli soup tasted fishy. Everything over cooked. 
Go to McDonalds around the corner. No wonder it's basically empty.

No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. Absolutely not. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. 

You can't be charging Strip buffet prices for crap food. Well, I mean you CAN do that and the Golden Nugget DOES do that, but you can't expect it to go unnoticed.

A dish of "steak" is filled with small cuts of very tough meat that are smothered with a sauce that is actually worse than the crappy gravies Heinz sells in a can.

The carving station turkey managed to taste like fish. It's a miracle, because I saw the guy cut the meat off of a turkey carcass. But it didn't taste like turkey.

Surely the pasta offerings would be better. Wrong. I think they fill their cheese ravioli with toe jam. It's terrible. Terrible.

I have a standing rule: I never rave about a restaurant's mac'n'cheese or mashed potatoes. I believe that those two items are simply impossible to screw up and none is truly as AMAZING as people claim. However, I can honestly report that the Golden Nugget Buffet's mac'n'cheese could very possibly be the worst ever created by human hands. Mushy, awful, chemically-tasting artificial cheesy nastiness. It's truly crap-tastic.

Do yourself a favor. Take the $25 per person that you would spend here and bet it all on black at the next roulette table you pass. It's a better value for your money.

This is a Fave on top of my Faves. There is just so much good food to choose from and the presentation is Fabulous! It's on the $$ side but we only live once or so we know, so why not Eat the Best when possible!
Very expensive and the food isn't very good.Small selection as well.For the price,your better off going to one of other restaurants in the Golden Nugget,and there are some good ones.

We came here for breakfast which is $22, no discount for a players card unless you have gambling points to use.  The timing actually ended up to be perfect since we were able to get breakfast and some lunch since they were switching.  Plenty of options and we all left full.

$20 bucks for brunch buffet on a sunday morning.
typical standard buffet in Las Vegas

highlights: omelet bar, good ice cream, perfectly cooked bacon.

service was kinda slow (even though the place wasn't packed), and the eggs were kind of soggy.

If you are desiring breakfast in downtown LV, there are lots of way cheaper options on Fremont St,  ie: $5.99 for steak and eggs, skip the Golden Nugget Buffet.
It's not the greatest nor is it terrible. It's a decent buffet. Came here during lunch. They had pretty good selections. $12.99 per person for lunch

This may be my fourth Buffet in Vegas, Second best, the bottom two way behind. The food is good, we went on prime rib night and didn't have to fight for it. Also a great desert bar, best "bread pudding" I ever had. Where they really excelled was a waiter named Darryl. I eat out a lot and this guy is something. When hes not filling drink orders he is busing tables, moving them for different size groups, He's beyond pleasant, every movement has a purpose. He's what will make me come back. Spent 10 years in a convention hotel, I recognize the talent.

This place deserves more credit than it's getting on Yelp.  The food here was perfectly good and a great deal cheaper than many of the other buffets in Vegas - especially if you have coupons, which we did.  It was a nice selection of food for both breakfast and lunch (Though breakfast is over at 10:30 :( at least the omelet station is open all day).  The staff was pretty attentive and very friendly.

This is by far the worst buffet we have ever been to; there aren't many selections; prime rib was over cooked! (Nooo! why you wanna mess up prime rib like that!?!) Other meats were dry as well. The only thing that was delicious was the coconut cream pie, but not worth $30!

Very few selections
Poor quality
Over-priced
Crowded in seating area; tables too close together

Do not eat here! I went with my boyfriend today around 3:30.. And had a horrible experience!! All of the carving station meat was bone dry and un-edible! And thats not the worst? part.. I was going to looked past the meat thing and tryed to get full off of the salad i had made myself but i had had it when i bit into a huge peice of tomato that litterally filled my mouth with rotten juice that tasted like decaying garbage.. I was completely disgusted i spit it out immediately and informed the manager. Her response was the meat seems over cooked thats all..a followed that up with "its a buffet" 


She ended up refunding the money we paid, i was very let down because i was ready to eat and didnt have the highest expectations but i also didnt expect to be served bacteria ridden food.

Now i havent vomited but i do feel sick to my stomach and dizzy i pray i dont get food poisoning!

Also the only buffet I would eat downtown.
Waitstaff if they weren't over the top friendly they seemed bothered. The cooks really made me feel like I was bothering them. Really your job is to cut me Roast beef sorry its so tough you need a chainsaw to get through it not my fault. All in all pretty crappy. I tried it 3 times breakfast, lunch, and dinner gross, grosser, grossest guess I wasn't drunk enough. What really sucks is unless you want to have a $100 meal or a .99cent shrimp cocktail that was the best option. Very disappointed

Took the family to this buffet while we were in Vegas this last week. We went on a Wednesday, which was steak night, and the advertised price was 15.95. Word to the wise, this is when you join their rewards program, so make sure to do that first. Our overall bill for a family of 6 was $102, which was equivalent to what we paid for fast food burgers on the strip. 
The variety of food was good, although I would have liked to see a little more variety of items. There were some things that looked like they had been there a while, which was not a sight to see. 
The steak I had was good, so that helped, and I really enjoyed the baked potatoes. My kids and husband tried a variety of items and the steak and shrimp was their favorite.
The staff was great and the waiter we had was fantastic. The line to get in was quite painful and, when I left, it looked like we had "beat the crowd."
I would say that this is a good buffet for someone looking for a deal and some good food. My kids and husband enjoyed it and it did not completely take all my money, so give it a try.

Visited on a Monday holiday. Eeeh.  Very small selection of options. Food seemed oooolddd. The only good food was the chicken but i could of gone to el pollo loco for that. Desert looks good but does not taste as good as it looks. Waiter was nice and keep coming to give refills thats why 2 stars instead of 1.

Great buffet. Surprisingly good for a casino. 
We came just as lunch started and we're so surprised at the quality of the food. 
They still had an omelet bar going which had very good omelets, they guy took his omelets seriously. 
Our waiter, Clinton, was the most polite and attentive server we have ever had at a buffet. 
It felt like we were being served by an English butler.
