Shout out for the orange chicken, the omelettes, the roasted chicken very tender and moist. I loved their mac & cheese, and I think I am a mac & cheese snob. 
My brother-in-law who works in the food industry said that they are using very good quality food. 
Only a few of the items were not as fantastic, but they were still very tasty, just not as good as some of the others.
Overall an excellent buffet. 
Thank you Clinton for your excellent service.

Good cheap place to eat in Vegas. For two people including drinks for a full Buffet the price was less than $25... NOT BAD for Vegas. The food is tasty and like any other Buffet you have to search and find what food(s) suite your taste buds. I ate here twice during my 4 day stay in Vegas.

I had the misfortune of dining there on 2/23/15 and left feeling ripped off. For the price, I was expecting good quality food, instead I got dry flavorless grub I had to force myself to swallow. The only thing with any flavor were the Italian meatballs thanks to the rancid Parmesan cheese. The service was great and staff friendly, but the food invited me to never go back.

The buffet here is just ok. That goes for the food and the service with one exception, Rene Martinez. Rene Martinez is a shining start hidden among mediocrity. He went way out of his way to make my daughter's experience amazing, as well as our own. His upbeat and happy attitude is infectious. He is seems to be the epitome of customer service. All said and done, the buffet here is worth a stop if you do not want to spend a lot or head to the strip.

I remember one of my co-workers telling me about how sucky this buffet was and I was worried about eating here, but since it was for a family reunion and I didn't have a say in where to eat - we had to eat here.

It sucked. 

The selections were limited and if it looked good, it wasn't. 

The only 2 good things that were good about this place was: one, It got all 30ish of my family members together and two, our waiter was very nice and patient with all of us.

Worst buffet ever for anyone with any kind of allergies.  I realize I am in the minority here, and my kids and husband did eat a good amount of food.  But it wasn't great.  

They have NOTHING that is gluten free for dessert.  Almost everything has dairy in it.  Cute little pastries, cupcakes, pies, etc.  I just couldn't eat any of them.  

I would not eat here again.  It's robbery for the food you get.

I've been coming to the Golden Nugget for fifteen years, and have seen the changes it's gone through. While I approve of moving the buffet upstairs to its new updated area, the buffet itself has really suffered. This used to be a four star buffet in food quality, service, and layout. Now it rates a two. 
The layout of the buffet is such that the omelets and carving lines block access to most of the hot dishes. The selection of fresh fruit us limited to cantaloupe only, there is no shrimp or crab at lunch. As a matter of fact, the only thing they have a passable assortment of is desserts. 
The quality of the food has also dropped substantially. Dried out turkey, pressed canned ham, and soup from a can is not what I want to eat. If this is their idea of good food, I know that I am not going to try one of the nicer, more expensive restaurants. Why throw good money after bad?
I can't understand how a restaurant chain can take over a hotel casino and screw up the restaurant. The only reason I can give is that Landry's wanted to greatly increase their profit margin.
I love buffets and I enjoyed this one. The fried chicken and Chinese food were my favorite and it's cheaper than other buffets. If I'm in downtown Vegas again, I will definitely come here again.

My sister and I are not usually to excited by the idea of buffett eating, but we new we had to try one whil ein Vegas over the weekend.  Since we were staying at the Golden Nugget we decided to try ther breakfast buffet this past Sunday.  We went in with a game plan- scope it out, and then make tiny plates, eat slow, and drink a glass of champaign in between eat plate of food.

We went early and got to sit near the windows overlooking the pool.  It was a good people watching spot.  I enjoyed everything there, (especially the omlet bar, and the turkey sausage dipped in syrup- sad to say though- I DIDN"T EAT ANY DESSERRTTTSSSS.  I was so full.

The price was a little more than expecting but everything else was amazing! The staff was super friendly and always checked in on us, we had 5 plates and desert plates we couldn't stop eating! Most buffets don't get it right with all the food but this place was amazing, everything was the right texture and taste and nothing had been sitting out to long, would recommend to anyone! After eating we were happy with Price due to the experience we had.
Great buffet at a reasonable price and there desserts are awesome the bread pudding is a winner....

Value for money. We paid $30 for two people to eat lunch. I had very low expectations walking in but was rather surprised with their wide selection of options which ranged from Asian to Italian, Southern comfort food to a wide selection of pastries. If you're staying at the golden nugget hotel, you should def check this place out!

First off I am not a fan of Buffets in Las Vegas. We went to the Seafood Buffet on saturday night and it was amazing. Everything that I ate was great and I did not only eat seafood. This is the best buffet I have had in a long time. I will say I have not been to the M or similar places that are $35 per person but for $22 each the Golden Nugget is definately worth it.

The crab legs were really good and get 4 stars. They serve both hot and seasoned crab legs. I also liked the Shrimp boil. HOWEVER, the rest of the buffet was not good, so overall rating is lower. BUT $21 for good crab legs is alright by me and I would eat here again.

I'm definitely a fan of this buffet, especially for the price.  Since it's in Downtown Vegas (and away from the strip), even the dinner prices are excellent.  The buffet was approx. $35 for dinner and soft drinks, juices and water are included.  The booze was cheap, also, so worth getting if you want a bucket of beer or something.

Sure, this is The Golden Nugget, which isn't as fancy as the Strip casinos and hotels, but it's great in its own vintage, nostalgic sort of way.  The buffet was large and offered tons of stuff from pizza to soup to fresh carved meats to salads.  Obviously, tons of sides available like mashed potatoes, veggies, breads, rolls, etc.  

I thought the food was tasty.  I've been to better, more upscale buffets, sure, but this place was good and the food was well-made.  There was no trouble getting in and we didn't wait long at all to be seated.  Drink service was quick and no complaints about the servers.

I'd go back again and I recommend you do, as well, since this is one of the better buffets on Fremont Street (at least from what I've heard).

Good cheap breakfast.
Small selection of food for a buffet. 
Service was a little slow to get drinks, I had to flag someone down.
The restaurant is really dark.

A reasonable $15 was spent on a lunch buffet. Fresh food- salad, fish, etc. Brisket was a hit or miss. Some of my party liked it and others thought it was too greasy. Pork loin, pizza, Mac and cheese, and desserts were all on point.
We most likely won't come back. The servers had no idea what gluten free was, so let's hope I survive the ride home tomorrow. Food wasn't very good, we just want to get back out on the strip

This was so nasty I would never go back there was hair on the napkins it looks like my cat rolled around on it The seats are so close that you can't get out to get more food without hitting the person behind you I complain and nothing was done very expensive for not very good food and not very good service never go back again I spent a lot and only had a bowl of pasta that's was the only nice thing is the pasta lady was supper nice but the manager was very rude

One of the worst buffets I've ever at.  When the best you can find at the salad bar is lettuce, cheese and tomato--it's pathetic.  The ribs, seafood, Chinese, Italian--horrible.  How do you screw up a simple calzone????  Worse part--$24!!!!

Totally gone down the tube. Way overpriced for food out of a box. Deserts are dry, old and inedible. Meat is like boot leather. The oysters stunk of dead fish. Plus just like the Paradise Buffet at Freemont, they were stuck to the shell. Very old.
   Wait staff was as rude as they come. Wanted a 20% gratuity for my party of 8. This is a BUFFET dang it. WE get our OWN FOOD. Then they seated us 4 to a table across the room from each other. The buffet had 15 people in it. They did this out of spite. Stay away.

It was ok pretty much just like any other buffet nothing special no one went out of their way to make anything good the service was really bad I didn't get my drinks refilled. I can't really say good or bad but for 20 bucks I really expect more. The mayonnaise was yellow and everything just seems like it was pre cooked and slaughtered with sauce. They have a 24 hour omelet buffet. I really like the fruit torte. Other than that just the regular spot.

For the high price this Buffett was a disappointment.  Food had been sitting on the Buffett and some the food appeared quite old. For a Buffett of this price, the food selection was quite limited. 

On a positive note, restaurant staff were present, very helpful and provided good service.
Food was decent and so was the price.  A little worried when a guy behind us got into an argument with  the man behind us. Otherwise  yummy after a night of  partying.

All I have to say is I wait in line and pay whatever it takes just to eat their spaghetti and meatballs! No joke I'm completely serious! I haven't had such good spaghetti at Italian food restaurants as I have here!

So I wanted to wait a few weeks to calm down before I wrote this. I took my wife and daughter to the Golden Nugget, being a new resident to Las Vegas we had heard a lot of good things about the Gold Nugget and wanted to experience it for ourselves. I am a food and beverage manager by trade so typically I am more patient but still critical of food. 
The Golden Nugget Buffet is the worst buffet I have ever encountered. 
In 20 years of food and beverage I have never seen specials listed as "Chef Special with coagulated sauces and chunks of mystery meat. The seafood salad was in chunks of imitation crab that was not even broken up and was hard as a rock with a pungent seafood odder coming from it. 
I went to the pasta station hoping to find some fresh items and the mushrooms on the station were black and the sauce wasn't an Alfredo sauce it was also some coagulated cream sauce that the cook after preparation scooped piles of parmesan cheese on top of. 
For $18.99 not only did I leave with a literal bad taste in my mouth but the service was horrific as well.
The server came to refill my daughters coke with watered down coke that had no carbonation in it at all, he showed up three times to the table and didn't even speak once to us.
When leaving I was handing my parking ticket to the hostess in the front who was yawning and when I approached her she put her arm up and continued to yawn and pointed toward the cashier who let me know I could validate downstairs.....
This seems to be the Fools Gold of Las Vegas in my opinion!

I would like to say you get what you pay for, but even at $18+ on a Saturday for lunch is way overpriced. The lunch here was like hospital food. The service was awesome, but the food was pretty bad. I ended up sick from the salad dressing which possibly went bad. Shit, I avoided everything else but still got it from the dressing. No wonder this was the only buffet in Vegas with no line. I should of just had bread, at least it was pretty decent.

Had a decent dinner for a decent price (Thursday was $18.99). Buffet lines were dog-eat-dog, people can be really rude, but the staff was professional and friendly and the food was plentiful and good. I'd do it again.

Very good service here. Waitress refilled my drink the second it was empty. Very attentive with replacing new plates on the table as well.

I came on a Friday night. Some nice fish choices. Clam Chowder was not the best tasting. Pretty boring salad bar. Mediocre sushi. For $32 a person the best part would have been the crab legs, but i don't eat them so I'm a buffets best friend. Didn't try any of the desert options. Had fruit instead. Hey, you can't go wrong with that! 

I dug the old school, never-been-remodeled vibe. It brings back old Vegas if you like that sort of thing, and I do. The place was not very busy which was a huge plus on a Friday night. No need to push your way through or wait in long lines! I should mention there was one waitress that was extremely loud. Simmer down. Just got paid. It's Friday night and i want to relaaax and eat in peace!

The quality of the food offered here is far from exceptional, but there is a pretty good variety available at a reasonable price-- especially for a Las Vegas buffet.

I was kinda surprised to see so many overwhelmingly negative reviews of the Golden Nugget Buffet here on Yelp.  Maybe these folks went in expecting gourmet restaurant quality meals made to order, but with the convenience and price of an inexpensive buffet.  Personally, I didn't have particularly high expectations for a high-volume chow trough on top of a casino.

We ate here twice in a row during our stay at the Nugget: a weekday lunch ($13) and weekend Champagne Brunch ($19, +a $5 surcharge for 'gratuity' as we were part of a larger group).  Both meals were hit-and-miss: fresh fruits, salads, made to order omelettes, and some of the side dishes were great, but pizza, pasta, and several other items were bland and/or incredibly greasy.  This is why variety is key; if one item is crap just get something else!  Lots of desserts to choose from, too.

For some reason the process of getting patrons into the dining area was ridiculously slow, but once inside the service was good-- especially when it came to providing mimosa refills during the champagne brunch!

I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, but if I were staying at the Nugget again I'd probably do the buffet again just because of it's convenience and relatively good value.

40 bucks for a below par buffet for 2.  Everything was overcooked.  Our server was attentive.  And refilled our drinks and got us what we asked for.  I think that we may have been early for the dinner service, but overall it wasn't a great dinning experience.

Golden Nugget buffet is definitely one of the originals.  Upon entering you feel the old world Vegas in the ambience, decor, the wait staff's uniforms.  Once seated, it is comfy and cozy.  

The food choices are a good variety from hot to cold. The salad bar has great choices from lettuces, to toppings, to dressings. The pastry & dessert choices are phenomenal.  

Service is really good from entering, being seated, waited on.

We're so glad to see that an original is still around serving goodness to the people.  Thank you Golden Nugget :))

If your reading this your probably in/from San Diego. If that's true then we have access to some of the best Buffet's in the country at our Reservation Gaming hotel/casino's. Golden Nugget Buffet is a far cry from even the mediocre buffets in San Diego. The crab legs were small, not as clean as I like. The oysters were dry, the prime rib was bland and dry. The shrimp was not peeled and the buttery fly fried shrimp was dry and hard as a rock. The server was nice and was at our service, but the initial sit down took a few extra minutes. For $28 I got a 2 star buffet, but back home I can get 5 stars for $22. The chairs were uncomfortable, but the drunk bachelorette party near us gave us ample entertainment.

Don't expect anything grand here. 

The service is polite, but the food is average at best. It's best to stick to the hard-to-botch items like omelettes and carved meats. 

The $25 for brunch is only worth it if you plan to really load up a few plates, otherwise stick to a sit down place or a buffet on the Strip.

You guys are trippin. 

We really enjoyed our buffet last Saturday night, St. Patrick's Day.  At their carving station they had a huge corned beef,  the prime rib was rare and delicious, they also had ribs, and turkey which I didn't try, but looked really good too.  They had crab, both cocktail and hot.  In my opinion it was worth it just for the crab and prime rib. 

Our server was very attentive too.  I told him how much I loved the Bourbon sauce, ice cream, and some kind of wonderful praline bar, he suggested the bread pudding and even brought it for me with more sauce to boot.

I accidentally stumbled upon this buffet. We were in downtown Vegas doing some good old daytime drinking and wandering around when it hit us. We hadn't ate anything all day! Time to find some grub and fast.

We were wondering in and out of almost every casino till we somehow made it to the second floor of the Golden Nugget. We scoped out the lunch buffet, and for $11 we gave it a shot. 

For a buffet, I thought it was pretty tasty. Granted, I do not eat meat, so I can't vouch for their meat dishes, but they had plenty of options for both vegetarians and carnivores. I read the previous reviews only after going here, and disagree with them. I don't know if I just came at the right time, but all dishes were freshly put out. 

I filled up on their numerous salads. Artichoke/tomato mix, caprese, pasta salad, 4 bean salad, and potato salad. All were delicious. I also had some mac and cheese that was pretty tasty too. The GN buffet really hit the spot, I am so glad we discovered it,
There's hardly any wait time. Most to all of the staff are friendly. There's a good selection of food, but wasn't flavourful. Everything was really bland for costing so much.

Worst buffet I've ever been to. Overpriced and terrible quality. We ate dinner and it was so terrible I would not recommend this to someone I don't like. Also very small. The waiter took our food when we were not done. The staff was rude and seemed like they had other stuff to attend to. My advice eat at McDonald's. ......at least there not rude.

Awful, staff was rude, fruit looked so old, not a big buffet at all and it was sparse.  Everything looked day old, except the meat.... sushi was soooooo dry....................
old women running the front going thru there purses couldnt even ring us up properly, save your money and go somewhere else
Service was good. Selections were average, maybe more selection on seafood. Waiter was attentive. The facility can use some renovation.
Don't do it.. eat somewhere else. This place will make you sick!  Crap food everywhere!

We went to the buffet for breakfast and I was not really all that hungry, I scanned around to see what all they had to offer, I saw the normal breakfast works, I settled on an egg omelet with mushrooms, jalapenos, ham and peppers with cheese (which was good) and grabbed some hash browns, went to go for the pancakes but saw there was no syrup, and I love me some pancakes with my syrup so I didn't get any, but found out later from friend that they had it in a corner, who knew. I sat down with my food and our waiter came up to the table an asked if we needed anything I asked for Coffee and OJ, man he rolled his eyes and gave tude, like he was too good to wait on our table and that's just kind of how the entire meal went with him, was at the point of not wanting to ask for anything. Then went to check out the desert bar and saw éclairs and cream puffs (luv me some cream puffs) and coconut macaroons, was very disappointed with the cream puff the dough was hard and edible, the éclair and macaroons however were delish. If I'm ever back in Vegas I don't think I will make it back to the buffet. I'm going to have to pass.

The golden nugget is a pretty neat hotel to visit downtown.. Its certainly one of the nicer ones (comparative to downtown hotels). We went to see the Gordan show and have dinner in their buffet. Man.. the buffet was horrible. The prime rib so scary rare.. the only two things I had was shrimp (which was way to soggy) and mac and chz.

Thats just sad for a Vegas Buffet.. we wont be visiting any of the eating places here again. (thank goodness I didnt try their expensive steak house)... Way to many awesome restaurants in Vegas to waste your time on anything under 4 starts..

The Highlight ?? Leaving .

Went here for brunch buffet. Nice decor and plate settings with a view. However the food options is pretty limited for brunch at least. Service was mediocre at best, but the Buffet itself has a grand feel to it!

We stopped in for breakfast one morning starving. The food is just average. You can't really mess up breakfast. The service was good and waitress was friendly. Not my first choice but if you are starved and don't want to leave the hotel. Swing on in.

Been here about 3 times. The staff are super friendly and accommodating. Its always clean the only downfall is theres only about 8 tables along the window that gives a view of the amazing pool and shark tank. The buffet has the basic offerings of meat station, soup/salad bar, seafood and desert. The sections are small but are kept clean and well stocked. The only thing i didn't like was they heat lamps. There was a race to fill my plate and get to the table to eat before it got cold. I had the lobster mac which was a disappointment it tasted like box mac n cheese with imitation lobster and un-toasted panko crumbs. However collard green crab legs and cold shrimp were good! Only thing missing is burgers n fries for the kiddos

This buffet just somehow does not work.  I ate breakfast and it was average lunch ditto and supper same.  They had this huge round of roast beef at dinner.  I had a slice it was so tough I could not cut it with my knife.  The other meat on the carving station was baby back ribs.  The ribs were better than average.  The salad selection was limited but very good.  The Greek Salad was very tasty.  The dessert  section was big but I don't do the sugars so I could not tell you how they tasted.  I did scope out the bread pudding for a friend of mine Stephanie in St. Louis just on the maybe she would eat here.  Stephanie the bread pudding was average sorry.  The two stars is the parent company that owns this should know better.  When the Golden Nugget buffet was under the old management it was head and shoulders above this one.  That is just not right..  They charge enough money to put better food out.  I just don't know why they won't step up to the plate.  For goodness sake Main Street Station is better as is the Paradise at the Fremont.

I got a great meal for the price I paid. I hate seeing reviews talking about how sub par the buffet is, but, Hello! It's not a $30 buffet. I paid $10.99 for breakfast and also got to sample some lunch items. I really enjoyed the French toast and eggs, along with the various pastries that I took a few nibbles of. I also got unlimited refills of orange juice and milk. I would definitely go back again! I would like to try lunch or dinner. The pizza they made was delicious and you can't go wrong with a scoop of ice cream to complete your meal.
Buffet good selection, price 20.99, reasonable for Vegas. Dessert buffet: most were very bland, not a rich taste. Ice cream maybe the best part

My wife Fran and I went here on Christmas Day. A large sign out front listed the items being served for the day. A price under $20.00 was printed on this sign for breakfast. But no price was listed for lunch or dinner. You guessed it, we payed over  $20.00 for our meals. 

The food was fine however. My wife enjoyed her prime rib. Even though when she asked the person carving for an end cut, she didn't receive one.

We asked to be seated with a view of the hotel pool and the shark tank. Too bad the pool was drained for winter time repairs. The sun was position perfectly so that the shark tank and other aquatic life were only shadows or glares from the sunlight.

I ate a little of everything.  Prime rib, cod, pork loin, and Turkey, all from the carving station. There was shrimp displayed, but I don't care for shrimp. But still,  nice to have more than one selection. 

Vegetables on my plate included mashed pitatoes, asparagus, green beans with bacon.  That's right I ate asparagus without being told. 

Cold cuts were cut up and presented very nicely.  Almost made me not want to ruin what was on display. Yeah I don't think so.

Turned out to be a descent outing. Here's to everyone having joyous holidays
 My thanks to you for reading my reviews here on Yelp.

Went to this buffet after my aunt's wedding and I was very impressed. Since we were a large group of 40 they reserved us a space near the buffet. The service by our two waitresses were awesome. They quickly came and took our drink orders and were so nice! 

The food selection was amazing. There was a huge selection of prepared meats, salads, pastas, and vegetables. There was a mix of Italian, Mexican, Mediterranean, Soul Food, and Asian flavors in the buffet. So, if you had a particular type of food that you liked you could find it or vice-versa. I loved that they had a deli bar with a fresh selection of meat and cheeses. I was able to add some cheese to these flavorful beans and sausage soup that I had--so delicious and the cheese just brought out more of the flavor! My plate was filled with a little bit of everything! I so wish I had a few extra stomachs or just more room in my one so I could have gone back a few more times. I am always a little unsure of buffets, but you could tell that the food was freshly prepared and put out for dinner time. 

The dessert selection--no words to describe how it was. I have never seen such a great selection of desserts anywhere. They had everything from pies, cakes, cookies, cheesecake bites, ice cream, 

The only thing is I wish that the buffet was a little less expensive. For it being off the strip and $25 it was a little pricey, but I feel it is worth for the most part because of the food selection and service. I would choose this spot if you are looking to get a dinner with a wide variety of options!

We ate here as a large group multiple times
On our recent trip. Very clean, great selection and pretty good value.
Would be 5 stars.
Unfortunately the woman who
Works the front desk, Loretta is rude to the point that I almost want to avoid this location all
Together. Loretta for no reason speaks down to people. Simple issue of needing a table
For 17. Instead of being friendly and explaining the whole party needs to be present she rudely states "well you have to wait", and snaps at us.
I can't really explain it in words. She was just horrible.


We came back as a party of 2 the day we were leaving our honeymoon. We chose to
Pay with a prepaid gift card (which we had used there before) right on the receipt after paying it
Showed we still had over $100
On it. When she went to apply
The tip her system
Wouldn't allow
Her. She sat there accusing me of not having money on my card and bringing a bunch of
People over to add the tip.
She held up the line making me
Pull the card out again and be so rude and belittling to me again. My husband just went and got cash after the meal to tip the server.

Loretta needs to take a customer
Service refresher coarse. I don't understand why she repeatedly was so rude to
Us. By the way no one in my party was ever drunk. As we were there at the hotel for
My wedding. When people put forth that much effort to get together, take time off
Work, spend savings etc. they should receive proper service. 

We went to the buffet 2 separate times
And had wonderful service.

My dining companion rated everything as awful. As this is not cheap I expected much better. The coffee tasted awful, sort of like soy sauce. Baked ham was strangely flavorless and country gravy disappointing. Collard greens and corned beef hash were the best of the lot. The staff was freindly and attentive but could not make up for the food.

Goddamn, that prime rib is RARE AS SHIT. 

Pretty trashy as far as food goes, and $20 a person. Skip this one and go to the Bacchanel at Caesar's Palace for a more expensive buffet, but will be an unforgettable experience.

This was a very average buffet. It wasn't bad, but I think I got my moneys worth more  in champagne than anything else. They kept refilling my glass with mamosa's and I was not about to tell them no. The environment is cool and staff is friendly, but not my first choice for a buffet.

Went there for Thanksgiving dinner ate the turkey it was just ok not turkey meat off the bone but because I eat dark meat I had to deal with it  Seems  to be a turkey roll 
So I went up to get desert and reached for a piece of cherry pie and a running cockroach came running across the desert bar Ill never eat there again this place can't be clean I can imagine how dirty the kitchen is,
Meh food, selection, cleanliness. Good price, though, and nice view and service.

The food is decent, good variety. Hot Crab legs were real dry (that's why I only gave  them 4 stars) , chilled crab legs were great.  
Desserts were amazing.  The server (Clinton) deserved 10 stars. Best service I've had in years. He should be promoted.

The worst buffet i ever been to ever the food was horrible the price was high because of a convention that was in the strip. i had guests with me that visited down town for the first time and i doubt if they wanna go there ever again. I chose that buffet because i thought the golden nugget is the best casino in down town and i know i made the most horrible choice for me and my guests. And i will never ever step a foot in that casino ever again. Old food that would make u throw up i had only salad because i was starving. Shame on such a hotel to have such a service

First thing was that the price was ridiculous (23.99 -Dinner Price); which the buffet had less chooses then at a Golden Coral. Secondly, the food was not enjoyable in the least. I seriously recommend spending your money anywhere else.

Not at all that good for the price you pay.  I figured I was gonna get a ton food near the buffet but damn was I wrong. I was extremely disappointed with the food that they have. It was very limited. I can go to other local buffet spots in Vegas and get a more solid deal with a variety of choices that you want to eat.

The Buffet at the Golden Nugget is not the best buffet to be had in Las Vegas, the Strip hotels have better, much better, but if in Downtown, the Nugget Buffet is the best one.
They serve all meals, breakfast, lunch and dinner and there is always some cross over so whenever you go, you will find something to eat.
The price is reasonable considering the service and the quality of the food.
There is usually a line but it moves very fast. We were seated for lunch in less than 3 minutes. Once seated a server is right there to get a drink order and to let you know about the buffet. They come by to clean up dishes and check on you. We loved the service, and very friendly as well.
The selection is very large. From a great salad area to a cut meat area, they have it all.
If you want Italian they have that, Asia, got ya, American, there is a ton of it. Their pies and cakes are super good.
You will not be rushed and if you want to linger you can. 
Children are welcome. Have a great time.

We were pretty hungry by the time we got to Golden Nugget on our way out of town. We opted to try the buffet, begrudgingly. I've never been a huge fan of buffets as they are typically disappointing and filled with loads of marginal food.
My SO on the other hand, loves buffets. 

We were pleasantly surprised!
Perhaps it was that we weren't expecting much, but for a Sunday brunch at $16.99 this place was pretty good. Here are the highlights:

Scrambled eggs were really delicious, mixed with ham and peppers.
Country gravy was traditional and very flavorful
Linguisa sausage was spicy
Pizza sausage (my SO liked this although I thought it was ok)
Ranch dressing on the salad bar was the yummy kind
Corned beef hash was pretty tasty
Tater tots were yummy
If you like macaroons these ones are seriously very very good.

Some of the things that were a miss: the desserts were very bland and we were unimpressed for the most part. Except the macaroons which were delish.

There isn't a lot of variety but I was so full so quickly and for the price it was really quite good. 

They had shrimp cocktail and peel and eat shrimp, both of which were nothing special. And there fruit was very typical. There was nothing special on the salad bar either.

The food itself was pretty well seasoned though and for mass production buffets this place was honestly, better tasting than the buffets I've experienced at The Rio, Paris, Flamingo or anywhere else on the Strip. 

The service was decent too.   

If you are downtown and hungry, I'd say go for it.

Expensive ($23pp!), and not good.  Nothing flows or goes together, line is weird & laid out so you start near desserts...just plan weird and not good.  

Example: they had fajita meats (chicken & steak, with some peppers and onions & spices), but no shells of any kind or flavor, no toppings/garnishes...

...at the grill...they had a baked (bone-in) chicken, grilled porkchop or some weird white fish fried and covered in egg...?!  WTH?

Reading the reviews, I was a bit wary of this buffet, but it actually ended up being not that bad. Average, but good.

We visited at Noontime on Saturday. To note, they gave us the option to buffet with or without champagne. So there is not a forced purchase as others have mentioned.

All the food was warm, the service was steady, and our refills came often.

The one downside I could find this visit was that the Asian food section was bland. 
However the omelette station was great, and there was also a great selection of desserts.

Overall don't come expecting this to be the Bellagio buffet or something high-class or fancy. Just remember where you're visiting.

Terrible. Don't do it. I checked in to get some work done and somehow ended up here despite prior experiences. My logic was that for $16.95 I could find something to fill my stomach and get back to work. WRONG. The sushi contained no fish. The roast beef had the texture of a Goodyear tire. The Italian food was so bad I am horrified to think of what they have done to the cuisine of my heritage.
The chicken parm tasted worse than the dollar frozen food. The ravioli's were bad tasting mush and the sauce or gravy was pathetically prepared.
After that the limited selections left next to nothing to chose from. A mall buffet in northern Wisconsin blows the selections here away. I next moved to the dessert hoping I would find something edible. WRONG. The deserts were bland and I tried several.
One last point - at $16.95 this would have been a very bad mistake. Actually it was 28.95 plus tip.

To be fair the workers were all very great. Friendly attentive excellent service. They made for the perfect contrast. Landry's shame on you.

Yuck. Everything was dry. The chicken, the macaroni, the mashed potatoes, the cheese on the pizza, even the deserts. The salad bar only has iceberg lettuce. And flavorless.
Wish i could get a refund..

Had their breakfast and brunch which wasn't bad but very pricey for what you get. Food was a decent selection and tasty for the most part but $10.99 for breakfast and $18.99 for brunch which is the same as breakfast with shrimp and mimosas. Staff was pleasant but better breakfast elsewhere and much better brunch at the Mirage for about the same scratch.
Found a piece of metal in my food. Had a party of 8 and no one wanted to finish there food after that and was only reimbursed one plate. We were just getting started to eat.

This place is overpriced and the food is disgusting.
The server I got was great. The hostess was extremely rude. She started arguing to the cashier in front of me. They were both speaking in Spanish and when I asked what was the problem also in Spanish. They just looked stunned and didn't answer my question. I will never set food there again and neither should you.

This is a good buffet in downtown Las Vegas, if you take it for what it is then I don't think you will be disappointed. If you come on here expecting the buffet at the Aria or something like that then I guess you might be disappointed. Some of these reviews on here crack me up, people expect some outlandish stuff from a downtown buffet, but from my experience this place is certainly better than your average Golden Coral style of place. First off the place was nice, clean and had good service, and yes the servers do bring you drinks so no self serve here. As for the food this is what I found when we are breakfast:

The good-the honey ham from the carving station was great, as were the scrambled eggs, the breakfast sausage links and every desert and fresh fruit we tried. The desert station was all around great, especially the creme brule and cheesecake.

The OK- the French toast was so-so, as was the bacon, and yougert/granola station. The omlete station was pretty standard but was fine.

The bad- the only thing I had that was bad were the sausage patties, they were pretty dry and bland, go for the links which were great.

Overall we enjoyed the Golden Nugget buffet, the price and selection were perfect after a long night on the strip. If you are looking for lobster tails or organic milk then do us all a favor and go to the Wynn and stop bitching about places like this one.

Very small selection, very high prices, very cold food, very disappointed...

I would suggest paying a little bit more and heading down to the strip and visiting one of the main casinos where you will have a better selection and be more satisfied.
Overpriced small not worth going to wait service is slow most food was overcooked. better off going to main Street station or Fremont way better food and not overpriced like Golden Nugget

We decided to try out the breakfast buffet because we received a buy one get one free coupon when we checked in to our hotel.  We were worried that the food would be cold because we went about thirty minutes prior to breakfast ending.  We were happily surprised that the food was not only hot but it was very good.  There was an omelet station and a steam table with breakfast .   Our party of four was very satisfied and we all agreed that we would go back

It was good. Went here for breakfast.  I  liked that they had a smoked salmon and bagel fixins area.   We didn't have to wait in line at all on a Sunday morning. It wasn't a gigantic buffet but they had everything I wanted.  Not sure they shoulda charged $20 a person---$15 prolly more appropriate but whatev.

We came here on Thanksgiving Day where it cost $30 per person(already a bad start)But the line was well over 2 hours and there were many people cutting in the other "Elite Gamblers" line which seemed to move at a rapid pace while the regular line moved at a snail pace.(This was getting ridiculous) when we finally got seated(3 hours later).Me and my family were famished so we headed into the food line and where there's another long line of people waiting to get food.(FYI this was in the buffet not outside) and we found very little selection of a variety which is highly unseen in a Las Vegas casino.Thanksgiving feast consisted of Turkey and ham that is hard to chew,your teeth must be strong or your dentist will be very happy.The salad bar were stale vegetables and salad was pathetic.The only edible part of buffet was the dessert which was cake and ice cream.


Overall I'm underwhelmed by this overpriced and pitiful thanksgiving feast don't waste your money and time.I would prefer if you went to Palace Station,Fiesta or even Arizona Charlie's Decatur much better than this rich guy amusement park.

We go every year for Mother's Day weekend. First, the wait staff is awesome! BUT, every year the food gets a little bit....worse. Many items were overcooked, dry and/or greasy. The omelets and carving station are the best part. The rest was, okay. Not horrible, but not great. Too expensive for the quality. And you have to pay for mimosas on top of the $25 a head to get in. Boo!

We went here for breakfast on a whim with very low expectations. We were pleasantly surprised. The food is simple but solid, the service was great. We thoroughly enjoyed everything. Eggs Benedict among best I've had in my life. Not flashy but doesn't have to be, just simple good food.

This is a very bare bones buffet.  I was staying at the hotel and was reading their magazine in my room and saw it said they had crab!  I thought to myself, how awesome, I can stay in my hotel tonight and grab dinner without having to leave.  When my mother and I walked downstairs, we immediately new something was amiss, it was dinner time and the place was not packed!  Also, the ad in the magazine said crab, there wasn't any crab.  There were deserts, and to be honest, those are always hit and miss at any buffet.  They had sandwiches which was very weird, I've never seen sandwiches at a buffet.  The selection o food was very small, some prepared salmon and chicken dishes.  I ate primarily all the veggie dishes.  I was very upset because my mom rarely goes on vacation and this was a two night trip in which day one's dinner was a complete fail.  We didn't get our money's worth and with the prestige of the Golden Nugget we were expecting a far better dinner experience.  The only positive thing about this experience was the fact I could use my $15 food credit here and get the points loaded to my Landry's card.  I hope management really gets a hold on this place because they can be lining people up by the number to get in here, Vegas is synonymous with buffets, they could be the leader downtown.

very disappointed. I have been going to this champagne brunch for years. the service was always good and champagne flowed freely. went today and not only was the price $5 more, no more free champagne. our server's english was not the best and it sounded like she said it was included but alcohol cost extra. it was $3 for a mimosa and $4.50 For a glass of champagne. the weekly paper listed it as champagne brunch for $19.99. we questioned them at the front and were told it changed 3 months ago. how would we know that? no offers of compromise. too bad because the food is very good. I just feel a little duped.

I feel like two stars is a bit generous but one star may be a bit harsh.. prob more like 1 1/2 stars. 

In short, just dont do it!!!

First time visiting Freemont Street. Our friends were starving when we arrived so finding food was on the top of the priority list. We settled with The Golden Nugget so we didn't force anyone into a major case of hypoglycemia. 

Considering we paid 20 bucks, on a weeknight, I was expecting something somewhat decent.... aaaand I was wrong. Everything had this wired gray hue to it. Mixed greens and spinach on the salad bar was wilted with small pieces of rotten lettuce intertwined. The romaine and iceberg was the only thing that looked edible. The beets were a strange hue of gray(ish)-red.  I wish I had taken a picture. I didn't even dare touch them. My fiance had a small portion of fried rice and chow mein on his plate and I couldn't believe he would even dish that stuff on his pale. Both looked like they had been sitting under a heat lamp for about 5 hours. SO dry and greasy looking. *gag* Steak offered was too tough to even chew through. My friend and I LITERALLY had to spit it out into our napkins because there was no chewing through that stuff. Simply horrible. Mashed potatoes tasted old and stale. Desserts looked like something you would find at your grandmother nursing home (then again, so did everything else). Apple pie had a filing that looked like it had come straight from a can...only with no apples in it. Just this wierd apple-jelly-goo. Its hard to mess up sugar, guys! They somehow managed. 

The only thing on the buffet that tasted even remotely decent was the carved turkey and scalloped potatoes. Oh, and the ice cream from the ice cream counter was edible. 

Honestly, Ive had better meals at HomeTown Buffet and Golden Corral and paid about half as much. 

Avoid, avoid, avoid.

Your typical buffet. BUT! I do have to say that this is one of the best ones with a great selection of salads!! Macaroni  salad wasn't sour! There was caprese salad too! Artichoke salad. And even a shrimp pasta salad that was on point! They also have pre-put-together sandwiches and sushi. They also have an egg omelette station. Their dessert selection could have included jello and something more appealing than pies and cakes...Overall, better than Paradise's buffet!!

The biscuits, chicken fried steak and country gravy were delightful. The standard fare of sausage, bacon, hash browns was here along with grilled veggies. Overall, it was a satisfying meal. Service performed well. We were seated promptly and they refilled our drinks in a timely fashion.

I am giving this place a low star rating because of 3 items that ruined this Vegas buffet experience beyond repair.
1. Coffee- This was the worst coffee I have ever tasted. Was it even coffee? It tasted like bitter muddy water.
2. Breakfast steak- It tasted like freeze dried meat you get out of a military MRE. I nearly vomited after putting this abomination in my mouth.
3. Canned fruit- Come on guys. You can't get fresh fruit?

you would think they would have a good buffet but they do not. i was underwhelmed. beef brisjet was dry. dinner selection was so limited. you had asian, italian and carvings. 

you pay $29 w tax but you realize for what? Not worth it. Better to go Main buffet even if it ain't my favorite. that bad basically.  

outdated resto, needs rennovation. 

Front line reception service was good and friendly. 

Unfortunately, this will be the first and last time we heading to eat at this place.

I decided to try something different in Downtown, so the Golden Nugget Buffet, here I come!

I read the reviews and most of them were negative and targeted for dinner.  The positive reviews were for the breakfast.  Let me check this out.

The selection was big.  Anywhere from the simple cereal and yogurt to salmon. Eggs Benedict and steak.  The steak was medium to medium rare and tender.  It was also flavorful. I also tried the freshly carved ham.  I was expecting it to be a little salty and dry, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was juicy and not salty.  It was really good.

I don't know if I would visit for dinner, but i'll definitely be back for breakfast.

We did the breakfast buffet.  Um, really save your money and go into Claim Jumper.  This Buffet is HORRIBLE.  The bacon was limp, sausage tasted like it was cooked 2 days ago, the french toast was like chewing on a tire, eggs runny.  On the other hand, the ham at the cutting station was very good.  Now don't get me wrong cause I like a buffet, but this one is truly worth missing.
Pretty decent.  Not the most extravagant buffet in Downtown Las Vegas.  Breakfast is typically best meal for buffets.  Dinner was okay.

The best bread pudding in the world. Beautiful poolside views, quick lines. This place is really underrated and probably the best value as far as buffets go in all of Vegas. Funny complaint - the chairs have arm rests which make getting in and out of your seat difficult as there is no room to scoot your chair all the way out. Comfortable but not functional in a tightly squeezed space.

I've been here before but won't be back again.   Very mediocre and overpriced. Service couldn't be worse. After a long wait I finally had to ask someone who wasn't my waitress to bring coffee.  Never saw a waiter again.  Egg white omelet wan not cooked through. Pastries were dry.   Needless to say they won't see me again.
The food was delicious. I did not have one thing I didn't like. We went on Memorial Day for dinner. It was clean and the staff was so nice. The ice cream was the best thing. So creamy and delicious.

Located in the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas. tHis is the best buffet in the downtown area,(keep in mind that is the equivalent to being the best kosher deli in North Dakota). That being said I was there for breakfast, everything was fresh. Here is what sets them ahead in the downtown area, lox, thats right I said lox at a cheapie buffet, and steak, thats right I said steak! They also put the salad bar out, a lot of places don't do that for breakfast. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!
Blech, do yourself a favor and go to ANY of the buffets on the Strip and you'll get a better bang for your buck. Not worth it.

I love the nugget, but this was the disappointment of the weekend.  How can you charge $75 on a Sunday night for 3 people and the best thing on the menu is General Tso's Chicken - something they sell at Costco?  Sushi rolls are junk, Polska Kielbasa is... well sausage.  Can't even muster some BS ribeye... just tough ass beef jerky roast. In other words waste of money.   Run away fast!

Came here one evening. We got lucky that it was seafood night so it cost $25 a person.  Food was worth the price.  It was not so busy and the food was always refreshed.  The staff was nice, friendly and attentive.   

They gave us a bucket to put all out seafood shells in. Very convenient.  I wish they had wet wipes to clean up after though.  The dessert bar was awesome.  They have fresh whole pies and a server to give you real ice cream on a cone.  

They had plenty of meat dishes and sushi but I stayed away. Too filling.  They also had crab mac and cheese.  

We stayed about 3 hours.  Next time I would like to try their mimosa lunch.

This wasn't the worst buffet I've been too but it's got a spot near the top. We took the tour bus trip and GN is one of the stops. Needing lunch, we thought it best to eat at the hotel since he bus comes around every 45 minutes or so. We found the buffet, not a line, not too terribly busy. I paid with my credit card and was seated. I'll get back to the credit card later. The food was...ok. It was food. We were thankful to not starve but it was a step above cafeteria food (the kind you were dished up as a kid). But it filled us up, service was great. Later that day I checked my statement and $2 was added to my total. So I'm thinking someone wrote in a $2 tip on the tip line. Because I know the price of the buffet, I know what I authorized and I was charged $2 more. I didn't call,  I didn't make a big deal out of it. I just thought it was lame. Want more tips? Work harder. Much better food in LV for the price, never again.

Tried the breakfast buffet this morning.  In a nutshell, it was just okay.  The staff were courteous and attentive, but the food missed the mark of getting 4-stars.

The chicken fried steak patty has seen better days.  It was dry and a but stale probably from sitting there for a good while.

There were more items I tried that missed the wow factor and fell into the typical buffet food fair.  

Will I be back? Probably not.  I think I'd rather pay for a good off the menu meal rather than an average 'all you can eat' buffet.

Ate here yesterday for the last time after over 10 years of one of my favorite buffets downtown. I lifted the metal lid off of the cream of mushroom soup and it was so hot that I had to set it down on the counter next to the pot. I scooped my soup into a bowl and I went to replace the metal lid back onto the pot but it was just so extremely hot that I automatically let go and the whole lid fell to the bottom of the mushroom soup. The woman behind the counter did see it all and came over while I apologized and she stuck her hand into the pot of cream of mushroom soup, retrieve the lid, wiped it off from A towel on the back counter and replaced it back on top of the pot. I mentioned to her she should not be serving that soup to anyone because it's now contaminated with the lid and your hand. She just ignored me and walked away. What else do they do that we don't catch? I know it happens  at all restaurants But when a customer catches it, they usually rectify it. I emailed the hotel and I left a message with the buffet manager because I was told there was not one on duty at the time. Have not heard a word back. Be careful. Be safe.
Came here during lunch and was able to stay until dinner. Good price/deal. I liked the selection of food.  Clean buffet and good service. I'm glad I came here. Will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

It's alright. I've had better buffets but there was plenty of food to choose from. The place was clean but the food was just....alright. There was prime rib, sea food, some pizza, pasta, salad fixings, and sweets. I just don't think that the price is a bargain. The service was fine when we went. Drinks and re-fills came quickly.

They food is good. Needs a little bit more spices. The servers are at your beckon call they do a outstanding job getting you whatever you need. They have everything at the buffet from meats to salads to Suites if you're a vegetarian they can take care of that need as well.

I love buffets.. and for Las Vegas I guess you sorta want the best of the best in buffets.  We paid $17 per person for this place and it was ok at best.  The food seemed like it was out for quite a while and they werent exactly speedy on replacing it with fresh food.

I guess the best buffets out there arent the ones at the big casinos, but the small places.  Heck even for GOlden Nugget, I was hoping even with it not being that big.  Ehh.. Oh well. 

Will I go back?  Sure...  but not for dinner.

Enjoyed breakfast and dinner during my stay. They offer a good variety of your typical buffer food options on both. The food was tasty. I particularly enjoyed their Saturday night Bar-b-que theme. My boyfriend was expecting crab legs and was told the discontinued all weekend and now have them only on Friday night. The pricing was average for an overpriced tourist casino unless you eat your fill on a buffet. The serving staff is not friendly and provide mediocre service during both experienced thus the 3 stars and not 4. Great option if staying in hotel and want an onsite dining venue.

Our taxi cab driver recommended this place to eat. He said it was the best bang for our buck, he quoted us about $12 or $13 for lunch, however, it proved to be false. It turned out to be over $20! Since we already commited to walking all those stairs, we decided to give it a shot since the ladies guarantee us that dinner was about to start and some good seafood was coming out.

Right when we sat down, our waitress greeted us with bottomless mimosas! We quickly turned our frowns upside down, nothing like a little booze to cheer up our wallets. 

The food was so so, I just snacked a bit here and there because I wanted the dinner seafood selection. Raw oysters and crab legs! I was the first person to attacked the tray of oysters and something smelled a little fishy. Should realized it was a bad omen, but I continued down the line and got a plate of crab legs. The crabs were delicious, but the labor was just not worth it. After I finished up the legs I went for the oysters, it tasted a little off and warm. Needless to say, it didn't measure up to par so I stopped eating it. As I reached for my mimosa to wash down the weird taste, I noticed I was low on refreshment. I realized we switch waitress and that bottomless mimosas were only during lunch and not dinner. How disappointing...

Next morning, I woke up with intense stomach pain. I think those warm, odd tasting oysters were not settling well in my tummy. Never eat raw oyster at a buffet or not chilled on ice.

Vegas is known for it's buffets but I was not impressed with the Golden Nugget Buffet. I called ahead to arrange seating for a wedding party of 15-20 people. When we got there we ended up having to sit at two different tables but I wil admit the wait time was less than 5 minutes. 

Our drink orders were taken within 3 minutes and we were off to check out the buffet. And what I found was a very limited selection of items, in fact I will go so far as to say this was the most limited selection buffet I've been into in Vegas to date. But the thing that irritated me the most was that several of the stations had empty trays. As in no food. Some new items came out by the time we went back to check it again but it was too little, too late. 

The live stations were also a disappointment. The meat carver was working with a ham that was about gone by the time we got there. And 2 other stations were unstaffed. But it got worse. The ham was tough to chew, and the sushi, beyond missing some tags to indicate what kind of rolls were being served was tough to bite into. In fact one could buy better, more edible sushi at your local Smith's than you would find here. 

I honestly REGRET that I chose this buffet for the wedding party we were with, and there is no way, absolutely NO WAY I can recommend this buffet. The Golden Nugget has always been a good experience for me in the past, but I hope to never grace their 2nd floor buffet with my presence ever again.

The Golden Nugget is a hotel located in Fremont Street area. It is considered old  Vegas. We decided to try this buffet for breakfast one morning the cost was $16 per person. The wait in the short line was the worst part of the entire experience. There were 3 people ahead of us and it took 30 minutes to pay and get seated. The breakfast buffet was rated as one of the best buffets in the city for breakfast.  The  food was plentiful, freshly made tasty and hot. They had hot cereals, pancakes, waffles, every breakfast meat you can think of and beverages were included in the price. There was a surcharge for alcoholic beverages. Our waitress was kind and attentive.  I enjoyed this buffet and actually liked it better than the other breakfast we tried in the area that had ala carte pricing for less quality. I would return to this buffet

I was pleased. Good food for the price. I started with the carving station (pork tenderloin, sausages) and then hit the sides. It's a buffet, not gourmet, but it all tasted hot and fresh. Nice selection of pies for dessert too. I'd come back.

OMG, I love a salad bar. And this buffet has one! So there's that.
Other than the salad bar, they have your standard buffet fare; prime rib, turkey, pizza, chicken, make-your-own pasta, a bit of seafood and quite a few small desserts. 
All the stations were manned when I needed them, which is always nice, but the server put my gravy all over everything on the plate (including the pizza) instead of just on the turkey and/or mashed potatoes. Nothing stood out as being super good, but it was plentiful and, well, I always have the salad bar. And the shrimp. I love shrimp. The sushi (California roll-type) was decent, too.
They never dallied in taking away dirty plates.

Not horrible, but NOT worth the price.

Most Vegas buffets are overpriced, heck, most FOOD anywhere in Vegas is overpriced. But this was $25 for basically glorified cafeteria food. Maybe if if they charged about half that you wouldn't feel so ripped off.

Then, at the bottom of the bill, they have the nerve to have a "suggested gratuity" of a full 15-20% of the bill, and show you how much that would be. Even though you waited in line, then served yourself. So that's for the guy that got you drinks. I know everybody wants to make a living. I just thought that was a little cheezy. Why don't they just pay the drink servers a little more. They certainly make enough money there.

Good price. Nice dining room. Great variety of food. We went right as breakfast was ending so we had the chance to try both breakfast and lunch. Best things to try are the bacon, omelettes, and ice cream :)

My experience is for a breakfast buffet. I must say it was a little overpriced but it was pretty decent for a Fremont buffet. My husband and I  enjoyed the omelette bar. I will come back to try their dinner if I ever go back to Fremont street.

As far as Vegas buffets go, the Golden Nugget isn't going to blow your socks off. It's not bad, it's just not great. My most recent visit was Memorial Day weekend so prices for buffets were incredibly inflated ($50+ per person) so when we walked by and saw the GN was only $21.99 we went for it. We wanted to get one vegas buffet visit in during our trip. 

The best options were the pastas- mac and cheese, ravioli, bow tie pasta. Lots of creamy sauces!Some of the Asian offerings were pretty good too especially the General Tao's chicken. Spicy, sweet and cooked nicely so it was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. 

I have a massive sweet tooth so the dessert section was heaven! I highly recommend the pineapple upside down cake and the Black Forest cake. Did not like the coconut cream pie or the apple cobbler. 

If you're looking for an affordable buffet with some decent food, this is your place. If you're looking for a foodie experience, go somewhere else.
Service is good the food is fair. Nice variety of desserts. But the main coarses include a lot of pizza and sandwiches- yes sandwiches and chips - might as well go to subway.

Roast beef very tough, ribs very dry.
Mashed potato thick and sticky.
If I had to do again would pass.
Very mediocre. OJ and Hot Chocolate were good. Fresh fruit as well. Everything else we had was flavorless.

Not the largest buffet in Las Vegas, but everything was delicious & well-prepared. The prime rib was incredible, and I ate way more of the mashed potatoes and macaroni & cheese than I'd planned, because both were THAT good. I enjoyed the shrimp, too. And, the desserts were amazing as well! Our server was fantastically friendly & helpful... Neither my sweet tea nor water was ever empty. Plus, she and another server made sure we knew when the buffet was closing & we needed to make one last trip. The Golden Nugget offers a great dinner buffet at a great price!

Expensive for the quality. My husband and I decided to make it easy this morning by trying the Golden Nugget's breakfast buffet. The eggs benedict were hard boiled. Dry. No extra hollendais... I asked. Shrimp, soggy with very little taste. Canned peaches better than fresh fruit. Dry pastries. They do have made to order omlettes. Best item I had. Salmon with capers, tomatoes, thin sliced red onion. My husband did like the blintzes and the banana cream pie. Not worth the calories nor the money.

Maybe I went in with too high of hopes?  Maybe I was expecting them to be able to compete with the big buffets on the strip?  Maybe I'm right and I really have experienced better?

It didn't start well when we arrived and found no line.  We approached the counter and the hostess told us to go to the other side of the counter.   No problem.  Then THAT hostess told us to go to other side.   So neither wanted to help us?  That wasn't a great introduction.  

We were seating pretty quickly after we paid for our lunch.  From this point on, the service was fantastic. The servers look like they've been since the Golden Nugget opened - but that's a good thing!  They know what service should look and feel like.  Personalized, polite, quick, and always done with a smile.  Good job to that team!

Unfortunately, the food was fairly basic, and in a few cases, less than.  I had some Turkey, but had to reach over the counter to add the gravy I wanted.  Odd setup.  They had sandwiches, which I guess is OK, but not what I want from a buffet.  I'll go to the pool bar for that.

The chicken was dry, the soup was salty - all in all, it was just basic.  They are a smaller buffet so don't expect a ton of choices compared to the Strip buffet's, but that wouldn't have mattered had the food been amazing.  

In the end, it served it's purpose, which was filled us up for the afternoon so we could gamble more.  Will I be back - hard to tell on that one, but I would probably want a 1/2 off coupon.

If I could give it 0 stars I would! 21.99$ for the seafood and more buffet (the only dinner they have). For that price I thought that they would have a big selection. They have cold shrimp, muscles,and oysters; they were in water not ice and looked like they had been sitting out for at least 5 hours. Eek that's gross! I would spend the extra 5-6 dollars and go to the rio instead more food and it is defiantly safer to eat since they take more care of it as far as temp. Goes! I will never be back to this buffet! I guess ppl call it the toilet bowl buffet! Beware!
Seafood night on Friday shrimp crab legs good variety.  Clams oysters fish best seafood salad ever.  Friendly staff
I was here on 8/11/2011 Love the food  great especially the made to order pasta. Deserts were wonderful. Sushi seemed a bit dry. Ate here on a Tuesday night for 18.99/person.

In the late 80's and the 90's, the Buffet at Golden Nugget was one of the best in town.  It's been a long, downhill slide since then.  Dinner tonight was skimpy, and most of the food tasted prepackaged.  I should have known: at 7 PM there was no line.  It used to stretch around the block.

Got a coupon for two breakfast buffets, had the breakfast two days in a row. Eggs were good, other stuff ok but here's the real kicker for me...both days tater-tots were the only potato option at breakfast. Classy.  

Mix in some shreds or home fries and I'll bust out another star on you @GoldenNuggetLV

We were pretty disappointed this this buffet.  Like the user below, we couldn't find a review on Yelp, but Frommer's rated it pretty good so we decided to give it a try while we were checking out Downtown Las Vegas.  This buffet is severely lacking and overpriced in my opinion.  The selection was weak, the sushi was absolutely terrible and the roast beef carving station I tried was dry dry dry.  The desserts were also really disappointing.  The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because our waitress was actually really nice and prompt and they serve full size ice cream scoops on sugar cones. For being one of the 'nicer' hotels in Downtown Las Vegas, I was expecting more.  Will definitely never go back.

A little pricey at $27 a person on a friday night but hands down the best buffet on fremont street. The food is fresh and prepared well every time i have been there. I go about twice a year.  The people who work there are on the ball keeping plates cleared off the table and drinks filled

We came here on a Wednesday and I think for both dinner buffets it was less than $50.00.

I was shocked to see this place alive and full of people. I was thinking of those Cinema -old school Downtown buffets for all you can eat for 9 dollars -lol

 We got there around 6ish and the food tasted fresh and was served hot. Nothing dry or stale here. I think the Chinese section was my favorite. the cook there was very funny and kept making jokes with me and my wife. He made this buffet very enjoyable. 

My favorite was the Chinese dumplings and the meatballs. We normally Eat at the Caesars Buffet so I am not comparing it to that. I am giving this place 4 stars for the value and atmosphere/customer service. 

Our waitress was awesome, we had some mimosas and we were not rushed out at all. This will be our go to buffet when we are downtown.

Much better than the Fremont Casino - Paradise Buffet.

This place was awesome! Came here to eat on a Sunday (for brunch) with our friends. The food was excellent, loved the omelet guy- he was so funny. The corned beef hash, bacon, and everything I had was great! Also, we enjoyed the all you can drink Champagne! Our server was the best. I wish I could remember her name. She told us she was born and raised in LV, and she was hilarious and on top of things. Great place to eat and enjoyed the pool view too!

If you have a coupon or you are already in the Freemont Street area this place is good eats at a pretty decent price.  All of the food is tasty, though nothing is high dollar and nothing is particularly unique.  The main problem here is that the buffet is pretty small, where you might find 5-6 large stations at a buffet on the strip, this place has 3 + Desert.  If you count the bread and salad island it's 4 but that is a stretch.

The staff is friendly and pretty attentive.  they could be around a little more but Every time they passed me they checked my glass so it was more that they didn't come by as much as I would like, I didn't get ignored.

The seating here as uncommonly comfy, the chairs were well padded and as a fat bastard I appreciate being comfy while I inhale astonishing quantities of food.

All in all it was a solid mid grade affair.  I would go again if I were in the area.

The Golden Nugget, where do i begin. The cashier needed my wife's id when her credit card has her picture on it and she said that the reason it was needed is because it's Nevada Law(kind of smart ass). 2nd the manager Adriane (i beleive) told us that the id is needed because a lot of transients have been coming to the restaurant lately.(Is she calli g us transients or is she simply stupid). 3rd my daughter's deser had something unexplainable. The manager could not explain or keep her cool. very rude and arragant african american lady. Poor choice of words..

Food not as good as the nationwide chain Golden Corr**, selection very lacking, staff neutral to slightly unfriendly.  Been to five buffets this week and all have been better including Main Street St****.

I love this place for champagne brunch. I have gone to other large casinos for champagne brunch, where they are stingy on the mimosa part but not Golden Nugget. The drink waitresses refills and refills and leaves the container with a group of 5 drunken 20 somethings is beyond awesome. 

Their food yes is average but they have a good make your own omelet station and salad bar. I loved the mashed potatoes. Pancakes were good. Place like I said I have been to the bigger more expensive buffets where most of the food tasted just like the Golden Nuggets. Biggest difference I believe is when it comes to the desserts. 

So go here for Sunday Champagne brunch. Awesome.

Terrible. Worst buffet ever. It's what I would imagine a prison food line would be like. Nothing is good. Trust me. The sushi is miniscule, with gross rice; the roast beef was dry and grisly (spit it out in my napkin); fried shrimp, really? You know how you know it's a shitty buffet? You're eating salad. With box croutons. Really bad. Baaaaad. Go to Dupar's at the Golden Gate.
Just not very good. Seems like the chefs are not very skilled. Everything cooked tastes the same. There was not a big selection either. There are crab legs and some mussels but that's about it.

The initial waiting in line & payment process needs help but the food was good. Selection was decent. Went on Saturday for brunch and had to pay a little more than during the week but it was worth it compared to how cruddy the Stratosphere buffet was. Easy to get full and satisfied here. Amazing service as well. Just wish it didn't take so long to get a table and start eating.

WEAK. For a "Nevada" casino buffett its week.
TI's is better. Luxor's is better. PM's is better.

Why is it weak? There was very limited food selection.
Ughhhh so GROSS. Why did we waste our time and money coming here? Honestly do not waste your time or stomach
I think this is the best buffet on Fremont street. But when you compare it to the rest of Vegas, Nope.

didnt like it. i thought because it was the golden nugget that it would be realy great, saddly it wasnt. there wasnt alot to chooes from and the hot food wasnt even hot, bearly warm is more like it. and if you like salad, dont bother coming here either it all looked like nobody put any though into the food, just kinda slaped a few styles together and called it a buffet. deffentaly not worth the $18.99

By far the greasiest food ever, couldn't even finish one plate before my gf and I got sick. Even the mimosas were gross and water downed, how hard is it to use real oj? Spend a little more and go to the Bellagio

I really think I'm spoiled when it comes to buffet's.  The Bellagio knocks my socks off, so the Golden Nugget just makes them slouch.  Honestly, if you go to the Bellagio on the weekend for brunch and get the bottomless mimosas...the Golden Nugget is just the same price.  I can say though that they have a made to order sauteed shrimp bar that we just couldn't get enough of.  We kept going back to try the different combinations of flavors (garlic, spicy, etc).  It's a push for me....I think if I stayed in old Las Vegas I would hit up the Golden Nugget Buffet but if we stayed at the HR as we always do, I probably won't make the trek.

This buffet was the WORST buffet/resturant I have ever been to!  The meat was dry, the potatoes were cold and the selection of food options was just sad.  When we complained the manager didn't even comp the meal.  Just a terrible experience.  One bright side, the waitress was very friendly.

When you've gone to other buffets that look like the buffet for the gods...this buffet easily would be disappointing to the eye. But with a fresh and open mind, they're just all right. Nothing spectacular or impressive. They are certainly cheaper than the buffet for the God's for common sense sake. The staff has always been ready and friendly. Felt like all my auntys were hard at work. Lo.

Overall, yeah...they're just all right. I'd recommend another buffet nearby but I don't think think I'm allowed to plug the other business's name. The food scene in downtown Las Vegas in recent years has stepped up for the good! I advise to try look into such places when looking for breakfast/lunch/dinner. 

Enjoy!

Brought my party of 24 here. The food was ok. They had a lot of stations, but the quality wasn't anything spectacular. The owner was nice and worked with our tables. As a wedding party, I wish they would have had one long table instead of two tables on top of each other. We had a few people that didn't show up but couldn't get our money back for whatever reason. Very expensive for the quality.

Will try a different place next time.
Down home American cooking , soul food , thanksgiving dinner , sandwiches and a great view of the pool while pigging out on pork ribs with sweet potatoes . Heck ya

Wow - I don't understand how this place does not have higher stars.

I ate here when I got married 8 years ago (before I ever had YELP - did it exist back then?)
I loved it then!  

Now as I stay at the Golden Nugget - AGAIN, I'm eating here again.  
Lunch, Dinner, YUM I love this place.  

The food is amazing.  The variety is awesome, and the price - unbelievable!!!

If you are staying at the Golden Nugget, or you are even at Fremont Street, go to the elevators, or take the escalator and go treat yourself to a great buffet for an amazing price!

We stayed at the Golden Nugget so naturally we thought we would give their buffet a shot.  Terrible idea....When we first walked in we were not impressed at all.  The decor was tacky, screamed old people, country kitchen.  The selection was not the best.  Paid like $18.00 for champagne brunch.  My husband had some fried chicken which was extremely dry.  I opted for the chicken fried steak, which after one bite, was the worst chicken fried steak I have ever tasted!  It tasted like something from my old high school cafeteria.  We immediately went and got our money back.  We then took a cab to the Treasure Island buffet.  It was better, but still not great.  I am starting to think the Vegas Buffet idea is over hyped!

Ok folks, here's the deal. We paid $18.99 for dinner (each). We were starving...and only able to eat the pizza and chicken salad. The salad bar looked good but we didn't want salad. The roast beef had no flavor, the "salisbury steak" was grizzly and couldn't be chewed easily. You have to peel your shrimp, the chinese food was oil coated with gobs of salt for flavor. Really, the pizza wasn't bad but just limited choices of cheese, peperoni or sausage.  My mom is in her 60's and I in my 40"s, and both agreed after more than 35 years of buffetting in Vegas...this was the worst for quality and price. We aren't that picky, but you can get much much better for a heck of a lot less. My advice is go anywhere else...you can't do much worse for this price.

I believe the Golden Nugget Buffet is one of the best on Freemont. They've a great section of different types of food.
We went on a Sunday, which was only $25.99 and it was Prime Rib night.
One of the best tips to give is to go around 3:30pm because that is when they change from Brunch to Dinner. You will definitely get fresh dinner food! The waiter was also quick to take our finished plates, which I loved.
The only negative outcome is that there was not a great section of seafood. They need more!

It is just right... not too fancy!

Atmosphere: 5/5 (Great view of the pool)
Price: 4/5 
Food: 4/5 (Need more seafood)
Customer Service: 5/5

We stayed at the Golden Nugget for three days and had a chance to enjoy the buffet twice; both times for breakfast.  

The service was exceptional but you can't really screw up serving coffee or juice (well, maybe you can, but this was definitely not the case here during our visit).  We found all of the breakfast items, as well as all of the items on the buffet, to be very high quality.  Hot foods were hot and cold foods were cold.  The freshly made to order omelettes were very good; the ingredients very fresh.  

This made us very happy.  We would definitely go back.

For Christmas Dinner, I felt a buffet would be in order.  Something to usher in a great new year. Something epic. Something Santa would like.  I was walking around on Fremont Street and decided to turn in here.  
    After seeing the world's largest golden nugget on display, I caught sight of the Buffet sign. I meandered the maze of slot machines and card tables and eventually climbed the stairs to get to the buffet. Twenty(ish) dollars got me in and seated at a table where the two nicest ladies helped me out with beverages and taking away my plates. 
    My first round was certainly meaty. Pig, Cow, Fish, Crustacean, Fowl....no species of God's creation was safe from my appetite. "Sure I'll try that." "Can I get a slab of each please?"  "Oooh. Let's get some of those!" I'll admit. My eyes were far larger than my stomach with this trip. Everything looked way tasty and smelled wondrous. I was also kinda sorta guilty about how many species of animal were about to be sacrificed to me.
    After plate number one I was considering throwing in the towel. Then one of the nicest ladies comfortingly said to me; "Take your time. Digest. You can stay all night if you want!" Thank you nicest lady. I really wish I remembered your name.  I broke out my game-boy and began playing video games for a lil bit to digest and clear out some space. Thankfully, I carry that thing for just such occasions. 
   After ten or so minutes, I made a stab at food sortie number two. I wanted to make my Mom happy, so I got a plate of salad. Crisp green veggies and red tomatoes. Even more numbers on the species list I suppose. All was refreshing and crisp and as good as these things can be.
    After the veggie plate, I decided to make a run on the dessert station.  I made sure to grab a full sized plate for this trip. Pies. Cakes. Cannolis. Moussey things and creme brulee things.
