I tend to overdo it on the dessert round. Of course, by this point, I was super stuffed and while unable to completely finish the things, I was able to manage a sampling of everything.  
 
   The buffet is great.  It's very pretty. It's very tasty. I'm sure Santa would have been happy. Or Jesus. It's his birthday...right? Happy Birthday Jesus! 

   I'll be back if I'm wandering Fremont again. Thanks Golden Nugget!
I'll be back. went there for lunch/ dinner. great shrimp,cuke salad, made to order omlents, great desserts.
Rude people at the door won't take your credit card and then want to call the manager at this is stupid I'll go somewhere else and I'll never come back to this place

This review is based only off of the breakfast buffet. There were plenty of options to choose from, everything you would expect and nothing more. I enjoyed my breakfast and it was a pretty affordable option compared to many other buffets.

This is the best buffet in Downtown Vegas.

There are better buffets on the strip, they cost a little more and are of a much higher quality. But for downtown, this is pretty good and a good value. Comparing it to the Strip is not fair. Compare it to the Main Street Station buffet and it is amazing. 

Compare it to the Nugget's own Carson Street Cafe (a place that has gone downhill) and the buffet is amazing.

This morning I was looking to have a wonderful breakfast at this buffet. I have been here before and had never had an issue with servers till now. This waitress named Pamela had the most shitty attitude I have ever experienced here. Her answer to "can u take these plates away please" was "can you wait I have drinks to deliver and you wanted coffee so I have to go make more". If this is her attitude to service people she really should not do this any more. I understand about having an hard day and she is tiered , and elderly but so early in the morning and the place is not even full enough to call it busy just makes me feel unattended for and she has no people skills. Making her seem incompetent and she was very rude. Will not be coming here again along with my party of 23 people have been told as well.

Not the biggest, or fanciest of buffets, but I gotta give the Golden Nugget Buffet an A-Okay for the cleanliness of the buffet.

Don't you tired when there are a lot of people who riffle through the food at a buffet? And what is left is a big nasty mess! Well, you don't have to worry about that when you come to the Golden Nugget Buffet! I must say it's rather clean, and very well presented.

I've eaten there mostly for breakfast & dinner in the past, and have always had a pretty pleasant experience. 

I was just here the other day for breakfast.........the breakfast buffet is not really large with a lot of selection, but what they do have is probably sufficient for you to fill your tummy. 

I do like that they have a carving station, and a chef that will make you fresh eggs or a fresh omelet.

Besides all the nasty breakfast meats - :Link Sausage, Bacon, Portuguese Sausage, Chicken Fried Steak, Spam, etc., they do offer a healthy fare too like oatmeal, cereal, or fresh fruit.

As for me, da local boy in me gotta have his Spam! Yes, if Spam was healthy.........I swear on my deathbed that I'd eat it everyday! That's how much I love Spam!!! 

For you folks (NFH) = Not From Hawaii..........Hawaii people eat the most Spam per any capita! 

Spam is da Hawaiian Steak Yo!!!!

See this link yourself - 
http://www.thehawaiiplan.com/why-do-hawaiians-love-spam/

And don't get me wrong, I didn't only eat Spam here.........I also had a fresh egg omelet with everything in it! And I must say the omelet was deeeeeeeeeeeelicious!!!!

To add some healthy junk in, I ate some grapefruit, then to ruin by healthy eating, I proceeded to eat a slice of cheesecake & bread pudding! LoL! 

Hey man, it's all about moderation right? LoL! 

Service here is pretty good, as the waiter or waitress is pretty attentive. They also leave you a big pot of coffee (if you're a coffee drinker), that way you won't have to keep bothering the waiter or waitress for a refill. How's that for efficiency?

Well, if you're ever in the downtown area, check out the Golden Nugget Breakfast Buffet.......pretty inexpensive too at just $12.99 per person.

Way overpriced!!! Horrible food!!! The buffet is tiny and has very small selection. What food they do have is terrible. The only thing I didn't mind was the bacon. But bacon is great anywhere. They only had shrimp in their seafood selection but I was too scared to try it. We don't drink, so the free mimosas were pointless. 

The ONLY reason I gave it a star is the dessert bar. The fruit tart, cannoli, and cream pie were actually not bad. 

Please, save your money and go someplace else. ANYWHERE ELSE BUT HERE!!!!!!!!
Bread pudding with bourbon sauce is great! Avoid everything else. Elementary school cafeteria quality food.

I was here 12/22-12/23/11, gotta give the buffet some credit, it was damn good.The food was tasty, and my fav def was the pizza and pasta. The price was great, considering I received a coupon upon check in for a buy one get one free, can't beat that... 
Gave it one less star due to the inpatient cashier, that seems to have issues. Overall still a great experience!

definitely one of the more overpriced buffets in the area for  what you get, which isn't really a lot I was not pleased at all by the quality of any of the food there was no flavor there was no Chinese nothing was scrumptious everything was just really below average.

Not a great spot for foodies, picky eaters, adventurous palates or people who don't love the American food profile, but better than other buffets in the area.

During our recent stay in Vegas, my spouse and I came here twice for what was essentially brunch in the mid-afternoon. They've usually got a red meat roast on the carving station, along with something I wouldn't eat, like a roast turkey or some ham. 

They have a little Chinese food and a little Mexican food, but nothing very good, very spicy or very interesting. There's the usual breakfast fare- eggs, bacon, sausage kind of stuff. I don't eat any of that really, but my hubs did and he said it was fine. 

Now that I mention it, I think that word basically sums this buffet up nicely. It's fine.

It's not great. It's not spectacular, but it's just fine, especially if you're able to take advantage of a half price coupon Monday through Friday. :-)

I don't like giving things one star, but the buffet at the Nugget earned it. I would put this Buffet into the category of: Not only would I not eat there again, I would aggressively try to change my friends mind if there was a group trying eating there.

We ate there for Sunday brunch (yesterday) right around 10:00am. It's $18 for champagne brunch even if you don't want champagne. Everything was cold except the omelette/egg stuffs the guy cooked right in front of you. No hyperbole on that. Eggs, bacon, pizza, veggies, fried shrimp, rice, eggs benedict...it was ALL cold. We started trying things we didn't even really want just to see if it was cold. It was.

Fine, ok. You're hungover and you're just going to drink $18 worth of bubbles. Wrong. The service is sloooooow. You'll be lucky to have three or four flutes of champagne in an hour. They don't exactly take the time to fill the glass up to the top either.

If you get suckered into eating here by your friends, stick with the guy making the omelettes and eggs. That'll be hot. And you can toast the bread yourself, so you know that will be good. The omelette guy will, however, cook the ever living bejesus out of your omelette so that it's dry.

They had everything you should have, but everything was sub par.  Tatter tots and biscuits (for gravy) were ROCK hard - like crumbled, that hard.  Waffles were soft.  The only fruit is cantaloupe and melon.  The omelet was good, and the bacon was crisp, that was the saving grace.  Service friendly but not great; it took a long time to get drinks, we didn't get refills and a manager had to bus our plates.  The main cashier was RUDE, and would not speak to us.  Literally zero words, we asked her questions about our coupon and using our Laundry's card together, and she would not even look at us.  Just told us the total.  It was weird, not gonna lie, felt like we were beneath her to even answer our questions.  There was a long line and she took the card, so we just moved on but it sucked to be treated that way.  It was really crowded too, but only because it was hard to know what line to get in to get food.  It was a crowd around one area, then dash to go next; everyone was polite but no one ever knew who was next or what you were waiting for (omelet station to the left, scrambled eggs to the right, syrup to the middle....ayyy).  Even with a 2-1 coupon from the hotel,  this isn't worth it.  I'm on vacation, why eat gross food with bad to terrible service?
